details.top: Allaah (Subhaanahu wa Ta'aala) says:
details.arabic: فَاذْكُرُوْنِيْٓ اَذْكُرْكُمْ وَاشْكُرُوْا لِيْ وَلَا تَكْفُرُوْنِ
details.translations: ''Therefore remember Me, I will remember you and be grateful to Me, and never be ungrateful to me''
details.bottom: Soorah al-Baqarah, Aayah 152

details.arabic: يٰٓاَيُّهَا الَّذِيْنَ اٰمَنُوا اذْكُرُوا اللّٰهَ ذِكْرًا كَثِيْرًا
details.translations: 'O you who believe! Remember Allaah with much remembrance''
details.bottom: Soorah al-Ahzaab, Aayah 41

details.arabic: وَالذّٰكِرِيْنَ اللّٰهَ كَثِيْرًا وَّالذّٰكِرٰتِ ۙ اَعَدَّ اللّٰهُ لَهُمْ مَّغْفِرَةً وَّاَجْرًا عَظِيْمًا
details.translations: 'And for men and women who engage much in Allaah's remembrance, for them has Allaah prepared forgiveness and great reward''
details.bottom: Soorah al-Ahzaab, Aayah 35

details.arabic: وَاذْكُرْ رَّبَّكَ فِيْ نَفْسِكَ تَضَرُّعًا وَّخِيْفَةً وَّدُوْنَ الْجَــهْرِ مِنَ الْقَوْلِ بِالْغُدُوِّ وَالْاٰصَالِ وَلَا تَكُنْ مِّنَ الْغٰفِلِيْنَ
details.translations: And bring your Lord to remembrance in your [very] soul, with humility and remember without loudness in words, in the mornings and evenings; and be not of those who are unheedful''
details.bottom:
Soorah al-A'raaf, Aayah 205


The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) said:

''The comparison of the one who remembers Allaah and the one who does not remember Allaah, is like that of the living and the dead'' [1] 

''Should I not inform you of the best of deeds, and the most sanctifying of deeds before your Lord, which does more to raise your positions [with Him] , and are better for you than the disbursement of gold and money or battle with the enemy?''

They [the companions] said: ''Indeed! Inform us.''

He (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) then said:

''Remembrance of Allaah (Subhaanahu wa Ta'aala)'' [2] 


The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) also said:

''Allaah (Subhaanahu wa Ta'aala) says: ''Indeed I am as My servant presumes Me to be, and I am with him when he remembers Me, so if he remembers Me to himself I remember him to Myself, and if he remembers Me amongst a company I remember him amongst a company greater than it, and if he draws near to Me the span of a hand I draw near to him the span of an arm, and if he draws near to Me the span of an arm I draw near to him the span of two outstretched arms, and if he takes a step towards Me I hastily step towards him'''' [3] 


On the authority of 'Abdullaah Ibn Busr (radhi-yallaahu 'anhu): ''A man said to the Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam): ''O Messenger of Allaah, the rites of Islaam are much for me, so tell me of something that I might hold fast to''

He (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) said:

''Let not your tongue cease from the remembrance of Allaah'' [4] 

The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) also said:

''Whoever recites a letter of Allaah's Book has for it, a merit and ten more like it, not to say that alif, laam, meem are one letter but rather alif is a letter, laam is a letter and meem is a letter'' [5] 


'Uqbah Ibn 'Aamir (radhi-yallaahu 'anhu) relates that Allaah's Messenger (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) came out when we were in as-Suffah and said:

''Are there any of you who would wish to go every day to Buthaan or al-'Aeeq [i.e., the name of two ditches in al-Madeenah] in the early morning and return from it with two she-camels without incurring any sin or severing relations?''

We [the companions] said: ''We would indeed love that, O Messenger of Allaah''

He (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) said:

''Then you should go to the mosque and acquire some knowledge, or recite two aayaat from the Book of Allaah, that would be better for you than two she-camels, and three aayaat are better than three she-camels, and four aayaat are better than four she-camels, and the same for a like number of male camels'' [6] 


The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) also said:

''Whoever takes a seat and fails to remember Allaah, has incurred upon himself a loss from Allaah, and whoever lies down [relaxes] and fails to remember Allaah, has incurred upon himself a loss from Allaah'' [7] 


He (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) also said:

''Whenever a people sit in a gathering in which they fail to remember Allaah and send prayers upon the Prophet they incur a loss upon themselves and if Allaah willed He would punish them and if He willed He would forgive them'' [8] 

Similarly, he (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) said:

''Whenever a people rise from a gathering in which they failed to remember Allaah, they rise as if they had arisen from the corpse of an ass and incurring upon themselves grief'' [9]
details.Reference:
[1] al-Bukhaaree with al-Fat.h 11/208 and Muslim 1/539
[2] at-Tirmidhee 5/459 and Ibn Maajah 2/1245, see: Saheeh Ibn Maajah 2/316 and Saheeh at-Tirmidhee 3/139
[3] al-Bukhaaree 8/171 and Muslim 4/2061, this specific wording is related by al-Bukhaaree
[4] at-Tirmidhee 5/458 and Ibn Maajah 2/1246, see: Saheeh at-Tirmidhee 3/139 and Saheeh Ibn Maajah 2/317
[5] at-Tirmidhee 5/175, see: Saheeh at-Tirmidhee 3/9 and Saheeh al-Jaami' as-Sagheer 5/340
[6] Muslim 1/553
[7] Abu Daawood 4/264 and others, see: Saheeh al-Jaami' 5/342.
[8] at-Tirmidhee, see: Saheeh at-Tirmidhee 3/140.
[9] Abu Daawood 4/264 and Ahmad 2/389, see: Saheeh al-Jaami' 5/176

details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِيْ أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَ مَا أَمَاتَنَا، وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُوْرُ
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-lathee 'ahyaanaa ba'da maa 'amaatanaa wa'ilayhin-nushoor
details.translations: All praise is for Allaah who gave us life after having taken it from us and unto Him is the resurrection
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/113; Muslim 4/2083

details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيمِ، رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي
details.transliteration: Laa 'illaha 'illallahu wahdahu la shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer Subhaanallahi, walhamdu lillaahi, wa laa 'ilaha 'illallahu, wallaahu 'akbar, wa laa hawla wa laa Quwwata 'illaa billaahil-'Aliyyil-'Adheem, Rabbighfir lee.
details.translations: None has the right to be worshipped except Allaah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong sovereignty and praise and He is over all things wholly capable. How perfect Allaah is, and all praise is for Allaah, and none has the right to be worshipped except Allaah, Allaah is the greatest and there is no power nor might except with Allaah, The Most High, The Supreme, O my Lord forgive me.
details.bottom: Whoever says this will be forgiven, and if he supplicates Allah, his prayer will be answered; if he performs ablution and prays, his prayer will be accepted.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/39, among others. The wording here is from Ibn Majah 2/335.

details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي عَافَانِي فِي جَسَدِي، وَرَدَّ عَلَيَّ رُوحِي، وَأَذِنَ لِي بِذِكْرِهِ
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-la<u>th</u>ee 'aafaanee fee jasadee, wa radda 'alayya roohee, wa 'a<u>th</u>ina lee bi<u>th</u>ikrihi.
details.translations: Praise is to Allah Who gave strength to my body and returned my soul to me and permitted me to remember Him.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 5/473. See Al-Albani's Sahih Tirmiihi 3/144.

details.arabic: إِنَّ فِى خَلْقِ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَاخْتِلٰفِ الَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ لَءَايٰتٍ لِّأُولِى الْأَلْبٰبِ
details.transliteration: Inna fee khalqis-samaawaati wal'ardhi wakhtilaafil-layli wannahaari la'aayaatil-li 'oolil-'albaab.
details.translations: Verily! In the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are indeed Signs for men of understanding. [190]

details.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَذْكُرُونَ اللَّهَ قِيٰمًا وَقُعُودًا وَعَلٰى جُنُوبِهِمْ وَيَتَفَكَّرُونَ فِى خَلْقِ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضِ رَبَّنَا مَا خَلَقْتَ هٰذَا بٰطِلًا سُبْحٰنَكَ فَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
details.transliteration: Alla<u>th</u>eena ya<u>th</u>kuroon-allaaha 'qiyaaman wa qu'oodan vua 'alaa junoobihim wa yatafakkaroona fee khalqis-samaawaati wal'ardhi Rabbanaa maa khalaqta haa<u>th</u>aa baatilan subhaanaka faqinaa 'a<u>th</u>aaban-naar.
details.translations: Those who remember Allah standing, sitting and lying down on their sides, and think deeply about the creation of the heavens and the earth, (saying:) 'Our LordA You. have not created this without purpose, glory is to You! Give us salvation from the torment of the Fire. [191]

details.arabic: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ مَنْ تُدْخِلِ النَّارَ فَقَدْ أَخْزَيْتَهُ وَمَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ مِنْ أَنْصَارٍ
details.transliteration: Rabbanaa 'innaka man tudkhilin-naara faqad 'akhzaytahu wa maa li<u>dhdh</u>alimeena rain 'ansaar. Rabbanaa 'innanaa sami'naa munaadiyan yunaadee lil'eemaani 'an 'aaminoo birabbikum fa'aamannaa
details.translations: Our Lord! Verily, whom You admit to the Fire, indeed, You have disgraced him, and never will the oppressors find any helpers. [192]

details.arabic: رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا سَمِعْنَا مُنَادِيًا يُنَادِي لِلْإِيمَانِ أَنْ آمِنُوا بِرَبِّكُمْ فَآمَنَّا رَبَّنَا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَكَفِّرْ عَنَّا سَيِّئَاتِنَا وَتَوَفَّنَا مَعَ الْأَبْرَارِ
details.transliteration: Rabbanaa 'innanaa sami'naa munaadiyan yunaadee lil'eemaani 'an 'aaminoo birabbikum fa'aamannaa Rabbanaa faghfir lanaa <u>th</u>unoobanaa wa kaffir 'annaa sayyi'aatinaa wa tawaffanaa ma'al-'abraar.
details.translations: Our Lord! Verily, we have heard the call of one calling to Faith (saying:) 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord! Forgive us our sins and expiate from us our evil deeds, and make us die in the state of righteousness together with the pious and righteous slaves. [193]

details.arabic: رَبَّنَا وَءَاتِنَا مَا وَعَدتَّنَا عَلٰى رُسُلِكَ وَلَا تُخْزِنَا يَوْمَ الْقِيٰمَةِ ۗ إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ الْمِيعَادَ
details.transliteration: Rabbanaa wa 'aatinaa maa wa'adtanaa 'alaa rusulika wa laa tukhzinaa yawmal-qiyaamati 'innaka laa tukhliful-mee'aad.
details.translations: Our Lord! Grant us what You promised us through Your Messengers, and disgrace us not on the Day of Resurrection, for You never break (Your) promise. [194]

details.arabic: فَاسْتَجَابَ لَهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ أَنِّي لَا أُضِيعُ عَمَلَ عَامِلٍ مِنْكُمْ مِنْ ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنْثَى بَعْضُكُمْ مِنْ بَعْضٍ فَالَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا وَأُخْرِجُوا مِنْ دِيَارِهِمْ وَأُوذُوا فِي سَبِيلِي وَقَاتَلُوا وَقُتِلُوا لَأُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ وَلَأُدْخِلَنَّهُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ثَوَابًا مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ عِنْدَهُ حُسْنُ الثَّوَابِ
details.transliteration: Fastajaaba lahum Rabbuhum'annee laa 'udhee'u 'amala 'aanulim-minkum min thakarin 'aw 'unthaa ba'dhukum mim ba'dh falla<u>th</u>eena haajaroo wa 'ukhrijoo min diyaarihim wa 'oo<u>th</u>oo fee sabeelee wa qaataloo wa qutiloo la'ukaffiranna 'anhum sayyi'aatihim wa la'udkhilannahum jannaatin tajree min tahtihal-'anhaaru thawaaban min 'indillaah wallaahu 'indahu husnuth-thawaab.
details.translations: So, their Lord answered them (saying): 'Never will I allow to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female. You issue forth one from another, so those who emigrated and were driven out from their homes, and suffered harm in My Cause and who fought, and were killed in My Cause, verily, I will expiate from them their evil deeds and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow; a reward from Allah, and with Allah is the best of rewards.' [195]

details.arabic: لَا يَغُرَّنَّكَ تَقَلُّبُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِى الْبِلٰدِ
details.transliteration: Laa yaghur-rannaka taqallubul-la<u>th</u>eena kafaroo fil-bilaad.
details.translations: Let not the free disposal of the disbelievers through out the land deceive you. [196]

details.arabic: مَتٰعٌ قَلِيلٌ ثُمَّ مَأْوٰىهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۚ وَبِئْسَ الْمِهَادُ
details.transliteration: Mataa'un qaleelun thumma ma'waahum jahannam wa bi'sal-mihaad.
details.translations: A brief enjoyment; then, their ultimate abode is Hell; and worst indeed is that place for rest. [197]

details.arabic: لٰكِنِ الَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا رَبَّهُمْ لَهُمْ جَنّٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهٰرُ خٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا نُزُلًا مِّنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا عِندَ اللَّهِ خَيْرٌ لِّلْأَبْرَارِ
details.transliteration: Laakinil-la<u>th</u>eenat-taqaw Rabbahum lahumjannaatun tajree min tahtihal-'anhaaru khaalideena feehaa nuzulam-min 'indillaah wa maa 'indallaahi khayrul-lil'abraar.
details.translations: But, for those who fear their Lord, are Gardens under which rivers flow; therein are they to dwell forever, and entertainment from Allah; and that which is with Allah is the best for the pious and righteous slaves. [198]

details.arabic: وَإِنَّ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ لَمَنْ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ وَمَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْهِمْ خَاشِعِينَ للَّهِ لَا يَشْتَرُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا أُولَئِكَ لَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ إِنَّ اللهَ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ
details.transliteration: Wa 'inna min 'ahlil-kitaabi laman yu'minu billaahi wa maa 'unzila 'ilaykum wa maa 'unzila 'ilayhim khaashi'eena lillaahi laa yashtaroona bi'aayaatillaahi thamanan qaleela 'oolaa'ika lahum 'ajruhum 'inda Rabbihim 'innallaaha saree'ul-hisaab.
details.translations: And there are, certainly , among the people of the Scripture, those who believe in Allah and in that which has been revealed to you, and in that which has been revealed to them, hum bling themselves before Allah. They do not sell the Verses of Allah for a little price, for them is a reward with their Lord. Surely, Allah is Swift in account. [199]

details.arabic: يٰٓأَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا اصْبِرُوا وَصَابِرُوا وَرَابِطُوا وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
details.transliteration: Yaa'ayyuhal-la<u>th</u>eena 'aamanus-biroo wa saabiroo wa raabitoo wattaqul-laaha la'allakum tuflihoon."
details.translations: O you who believe! Have patience and contend in patience, be vigilant and informed, and fear Allah, so that you may be successful. [200]
details.bottom: Qur'an Al-'Imran 3: 190-200;
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/237; Muslim 1/530

details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي كَسَانِي هَذَا (الثَّوْبَ) وَرَزَقَنِيهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلاَ قُوَّةٍ
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-la<u>th</u>ee kasaanee haa<u>th</u>aa (aththawba) wa razaqaneehi min ghayri hawlim-minnee wa laa quwwatin
details.translations: All Praise is for Allaah who has clothed me with this [garment] and provided it for me, with no power nor might from myself.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawud 4023, Ibn Majah 3285, At-Tirmithi 3458. Graded hasan By Al- Albani. See also 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 7/47

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ أَنْتَ كَسَوْتَنِيهِ، أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِهِ وَخَيْرِ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهِ وَشَرِّ مَا صُنِعَ لَهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'lakal-hamdu 'Anta kasawtaneehi, 'as'aluka min khayrihi wa khayri maa suni'a lahu, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min sharrihi wa sharri ma suni'a lahu.
details.translations: O Allaah, for You is all praise, You have clothed me with it, I ask You for the good of it and the good for which it was made, and I seek refuge with You from the evil of it and the evil for which it was made
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4020 and At-Tirmithi 1767. See also Al-Albani, Mukhtasar Shamd'il At-Tirmithi, p. 47

details.arabic: تُبْلِي وَيُخْلِفُ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى
details.transliteration: Tublee wa yukhliful-laahu ta'aalaa.
details.translations: May you wear it out and Allaah (Ta'aala) replace it [with another]
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/41. See also Al-Albani Sahih Abu Dawud 2/760.

pageTitle: To someone wearing a new garment #1

details.arabic: اِلْبَسْ جَدِيداً وَعِشْ حَمِيداً وَمُتْ شَهِيداً
details.transliteration: Ilbas jadeedan, wa 'ish hameedan, wa mut shaheedan.
details.translations: Wear anew, live commendably and die a shaheed.
details.Reference: Ibn Majah 2/1178, Al-Baghawi 12/41. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/275

pageTitle: To someone wearing a new garment #2

details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi
details.translations: In the name of Allaah
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 2/505, among others. See 'Irwa'ul Ghalil no. 49 and Sahihul-Jami' 3/203

details.top: Before entering
details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi
details.translations: In the Name of Allah.

details.top: Then
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْخُبْثِ وَالْخَبَائِثِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minal-khubthi walkhabaa'ith.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek protection in You from the male and female unclean spirits.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/45, Muslim 1/283. The addition of Bismillah at its beginning was reported by Said bin Mansur. See Fathul-Bari 1/244

details.arabic: غُفْرَانَكَ
details.transliteration: Ghufraanaka
details.translations: I seek Your forgiveness.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 30, Ibn Majah 300 and At-Tirmithi 7. An-Nasa'i recorded it in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah No 79. Graded Sahih by Al-Albani in Sunan Abi Dawud 1/19. Also see the checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad, 2/387.

details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi
details.translations: In the Name of Allah.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 101, Ibn Majah 337, and Ahmad. 9418 See also Al-Albani, 'Irwa'ul-Ghain 1/122

details.arabic: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ
details.transliteration: Ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu wa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluhu.
details.translations: I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner; and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/209

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِي مِنَ التَّوَّابِينَ وَاجْعَلْنِي مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِينَ
details.transliteration: A llaahummaj'alnee minat-tawwaabeena waj'alnee minal-mutatahhireen.
details.translations: O Allah, make me among those who turn to You in repentance, and make me among those who are purified.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 1/78. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At- Tirmithi 1/18

details.arabic: سُبْحانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْكَ
details.transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma wa bihamdika, 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, 'astaghfiruka wa 'atoobu 'ilayk
details.translations: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise; I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance.
details.Reference: An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, p. 173. See also Al-Albani, 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 1/135 and 2/94.

details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ، وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi, tawakkaltu 'alallaahi, wa laa hawla wa laa quwwata illaa billaah.
details.translations: In the Name of Allah, I have placed my trust in Allah, there is no might and no power except by Allah.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/325, At-Tirmithi 5/490. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/151

details.arabic: اللّٰـهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ، أَوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَزِلَّ، أَوْ أُزَلَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ، أَوْ أُظْلَمَ، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ، أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika 'an 'adhilla, 'aw 'udhalla, 'aw 'azilla, 'aw 'uzalla, 'aw 'a<u>dh</u>lima, 'aw 'u<u>dh</u>lama, 'aw 'ajhala 'aw yujhala 'alayya.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I misguide others, or I am misguided by others, lest I cause others to err or I am caused to err, lest I abuse others or be abused, and lest I behave foolishly or meet with the foolishness of others.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 5094, Ibn Majah 3884, An-Nasa'I 5501, At-Tirmithi 3427. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/336

details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَلَجْنَا، وَبِسْمِ اللَّهِ خَرَجْنَا، وَعَلَى اللَّهِ رَبِّنَا تَوَكَّلْنَا
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi walajnaa, wa bismillaahi kharajnaa, wa 'alaaRabblnaa tawakkalnaa
details.translations: In the Name of Allah we enter, in the Name of Allah we leave, and upon our Lord we depend
details.bottom: Then say As-Salaamu 'Alaykum to those present.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/325. Muslim 2018 states that one should mention the Name of Allah when entering the home and when beginning to eat; and that the devil, hearing this, says: 'There is no shelter for us here tonight and no food.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ فِي قَلْبِي نُوراً، وَفِي لِسَانِي نُوراً، وَفِي سَمْعِي نُوراً، وَفِي بَصَرِي نُوراً، وَمِنْ فَوْقِي نُوراً، وَمِنْ تَحْتِي نُوراً، وَعَنْ يَمِينِي نُوراً، وَعَنْ شِمَالِي نُوراً، وَمِنْ أَمَامِي نُوراً، وَمِنْ خَلْفِي نُوراً، وَاجْعَلْ فِي نَفْسِي نُوراً، وَأَعْظِمْ لِي نُوراً، وَعَظِّمْ لِي نُوراً، وَاجْعَلْ لِي نُوراً، وَاجْعَلْنِي نُوراً، اللَّهُمَّ أَعْطِنِي نُوراً، وَاجْعَلْ فِي عَصَبِي نُوراً، وَفِي لَحْمِي نُوراً، وَفِي دَمِي نُوراً، وَفِي شَعْرِي نُوراً، وَفِي بَشَرِي نُوراً،
details.transliteration: Allaahummaj'al fee qalbee nooran, wa fee lisaaanee nooran, wa fee sam'ee nooran, wa fee basaree nooran, wa min fawqee nooran, wa min tahtee nooran, wa 'an yameenee nooran, wa 'an shimaalee nooran, wa min 'amaamee nooran, wa min khalfee nooran, waj'alfee nafsee nooran, wa 'a'<u>dh</u>im lee nooran, wa 'a<u>dhdh</u>im lee nooran, wafal lee nooran, waj'alnee nooran, Allaahumma 'a'tinee nooran, waj'al fee 'asabee nooran, wafee lahmee nooran, wafee damee nooran, wa fee sha'ree nooran, wa fee basharee nooran.
details.translations: O Allah, place light in my heart, and on my tongue light, and in my ears light and in my sight light, and above me light, and below me light, and to my right light, and to my left light, and before me light and behind me light. Place in my soul light. Magnify for me light, and amplify for me light. Make for me light and make me a light. O Allah, grant me light, and place light in my nerves, and in my body light and in my blood light and in my hair light and in my skin light. [1]

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ لِي نُوراً فِي قَبْرِي… وَنُوراً فِي عِظَامِي
details.transliteration: Allaahummaj'al lee nooran fee qabree wa nooran fee 'i<u>dh</u>aamee.
details.translations: O Allah, make for me a light in my grave... and a light in my bones. [2]

details.arabic: وَزِدْنِي نُوراً، وَزِدْنِي نُوراً، وَزِدْنِي نُوراً
details.transliteration: Wa zidnee nooran, wa zidnee nooran, wa zidnee nooran.
details.translations: Increase me in light, increase me in light, increase me in light. [3]

details.arabic: وَهَبْ لِي نُوراً عَلَى نُورٍ
details.transliteration: Wa hab lee nooran 'alaa noor.
details.translations: Grant me light upon light. [4]
details.Reference:
[1] Up to this point was reported by Al-Bukhari 11 / 116 (Hadith no. 6316) and by Muslim 1/526, 529-530 (Hadithno. 763).
[2] At-Tirmithi 5/483 (Hadith no. 3419).
[3] Al-Bukhari in Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad (Hadith no. 695), p. 258. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad(no. 536).
[4] Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/118.

details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ العَظِيمِ، وَبِوَجْهِهِ الْكَرِيمِ، وَسُلْطَانِهِ الْقَدِيمِ، مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
details.transliteration: A'oo<u>th</u>u billaahil-'A<u>dh</u>eem, wa bi-Wajhihil-Kareem, wa Sultaanihil-qadeem, minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
details.translations: I seek refuge in Almighty Allah, by His Noble Face, by His primordial power, from Satan the outcast. [1]

details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi,
details.translations: In the Name of Allah, [2]

details.arabic: وَالصَّلَاةُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Wassalaatu Wassalaamu 'alaaRasoolillaahi.
details.translations: And blessings and peace be upon the Messenger of Allah. [3]

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ افْتَحْ لِي أَبْوَابَ رَحْمَتِكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maftah lee 'abwaaba rahmatika.
details.translations: O Allah, open before me the doors of Your mercy. [4]
details.Reference:
[1] Abu Dawud and Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jdmi' As-Saghir (Hadithno. 4591).
[2] Ibn As-Sunni (Hadith no. 88), graded good by Al-Albani.
[3] Abu Dawud 1/126, see also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 1/528.
[4] Muslim 1/494. There is also a report in Sunan Ibn Majah on the authority of Fatimah (RA), : 'O Allah, forgive me my sins and open for me the doors of Your mercy.' It was graded authentic by Al-Albani due to supporting Ahadith. See Sahih Ibn Majah 1/128-9.

details.top:
Leave with your left foot first. [1] 

Then say:
details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَالصّلَاةُ وَالسَّلَامُ عَلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِك، اللَّهُمَّ اعْصِمْنِي مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ،
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi wassalaatu wassalaamu 'alaa Rasoolillaahi, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka min fadhlika, Allaahumma'simnee minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
details.translations: In the Name of Allah, and peace and blessings be upon the Messenger of Allah. O Allah, I ask for Your favor, O Allah, protect me from Satan the outcast.
details.Reference:
[1] Al-Hakim, Baihaqi 2/442 Albani graded it Sahih in silsilah as Sahih 5/624.
[2] Reference same as previous dua. The last sentence is related by Ibn Maajah, see Saheeh Ibn Maajah 1/129

details.top: One repeats just as the mu'adhdhin [one who calls to prayer] says, except when he says:
details.arabic: حَيَّ عَلَى الصَّلاَةِ وَحَيَّ عَلَى الْفَلَاحِ
details.transliteration: Hayya 'alas-Salaah wa Hayya 'alal-Falaah
details.translations: Hasten to the prayer, Hasten to Success

details.top: Instead, one should say:
details.arabic: لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Laa hawla wa laa quwwata 'illaa billaah.
details.translations: There is no might and no power except by Allah. [1]

details.top: Immediately following the declaration of faith called by the mu'adhdhin, one says:
details.arabic: وَأَنَا أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ، رَضِيتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبَّاً، وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ رَسُولاً، وَبِالْإِسْلاَمِ دِينَاً
details.transliteration: Wa 'anaa 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu wa 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluhu, radheetu billaahi Rabban, wa bi-Muhammadin Rasoolan wa bil'islaami deenan.
details.translations: I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, and that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger. I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Muhammad as my Messenger and with Islam as my religion. [2, 3]

details.top: After replying to the call of mu'adhdhin. you should recite in Arabic Allah's blessings on the Prophet. [4]
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ هَذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ، وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ، آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيلَةَ وَالْفَضِيلَةَ، وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامَاً مَحمُوداً الَّذِي وَعَدْتَهُ، [إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ الْمِيعَادَ]
details.transliteration: Allaahumma Rabba haa<u>th</u>ihid-da 'watit-taammati wassalaatil-qaa'imati, 'aati Muhammadanil-waseelata walfadheelata, wab 'ath-hu maqaamam-mahmoodanil-la<u>th</u>ee wa'adtahu, ['innaka laa tukhliful-mee'aad]
details.translations: O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and established prayer. Grant Muhammad the intercession and favor, and raise him to the honored station You have promised him, [verily You do not neglect promises] . [5]
details.bottom: Between the call to prayer and the 'Iqamah, you should supplicate Allah for yourself. Invocation during this time is not rejected. [6]
details.Reference:
[1] Al-Bukhari 1/152, Muslim 1/288.
[2] Muslim 1/290.
[3] Ibn Khuzaymah 1/220.
[4] Muslim 1/288.
[5] Al-Bukhari 1/152, and the addition between brackets is from Al-Bayhaqi 1/410 with a good (Hasan) chain of narration. See 'Abdul-Azlz bin Baz's Tuhfatul-'Akhyar, pg. 38.
[6] At-Tirmidhi, Abu Dawud, Ahmad, See also Al-Albani, Irwa ul-Ghalil 1/262

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بَاعِدْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَ خَطَايَايَ كَمَا بَاعَدْتَ بَيْنَ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ، اللَّهُمَّ نَقِّنِي مِنْ خَطَايَايَ كَمَا يُنَقَّى الثَّوْبُ الْأَبْيَضُ مِنَ الدَّنَسِ، اللَّهُمَّ اغْسِلْني مِنْ خَطَايَايَ، بِالثَّلْجِ وَالْماءِ وَالْبَرَدِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma baa'id baynee wa bayna khataayaaya kamaa baa'adta baynal-mashriqi walmaghribi, Allaahumma naqqinee min khataayaaya kamaa yunaqqath-thawbul-'abyadhu minad-danasi, Allaahum-maghsilnee min khataayaaya, bith-thalji walmaa'i walbarad.
details.translations: O Allah, separate me from my sins as You have separated the East from the West. O Allah, cleanse me of my transgressions as the white garment is cleansed of stains. O Allah, wash away my sins with ice and water and frost.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/181, Muslim 1/419

pageTitle: At the start of the prayer #1

details.arabic: سُبْحانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ، وَتَبارَكَ اسْمُكَ، وَتَعَالَى جَدُّكَ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ غَيْرُكَ
details.transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma wa bihamdika, wa tabaarakasmuka, wa ta'aalaa jadduka, wa laa 'ilaaha ghayruka.
details.translations: Glory is to You O Allah, and praise. Blessed is Your Name and Exalted is Your Majesty. There is none worthy of worship but You.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 775, Ibn Majah 806, An-Nasa'I 899, At-Tirmithi 283. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/77 and Sahih Ibn Majah 1/135.

pageTitle: At the start of the prayer #2

details.arabic: وَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي فَطَرَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضَ حَنِيفَاً وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ، إِنَّ صَلاَتِي، وَنُسُكِي، وَمَحْيَايَ، وَمَمَاتِي لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ، لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَبِذَلِكَ أُمِرْتُ وَأَنَا مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
details.transliteration: Wajjahtu wajhiya lillathee fataras-samawati wal-arda haneefan wama ana minal-mushrikeen, inna salatee wanusukee wamahyaya wamamatee lillahi rabbil-AAalameen, la shareeka lahu wabithalika omirtu wa-ana minal-muslimeen.
details.translations: I have turned my face sincerely towards He who has brought forth the heavens and the Earth and I am not of those who associate (others with Allah). Indeed my prayer, my sacrifice, my life and my death are for Allah, Lord of the worlds, no partner has He, with this I am commanded and I am of the Muslims.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ المَلِكُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، أَنْتَ رَبِّي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ، ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي وَاعْتَرَفْتُ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي ذُنُوبِي جَمِيعَاً إِنَّهُ لاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، وَاهْدِنِي لِأَحْسَنِ الأَخْلَاقِ لاَ يَهْدِي لِأَحْسَنِها إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، وَاصْرِفْ عَنِّي سَيِّئَهَا، لاَ يَصْرِفُ عَنِّي سَيِّئَهَا إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: Allahumma antal-maliku la ilaha illa ant. anta rabbee wa-ana AAabduk, thalamtu nafsee waAAtaraftu bithanbee faghfir lee thunoobee jameeAAan innahu la yaghfiruth-thunooba illa ant.wahdinee li-ahsanil-akhlaqi la yahdee li-ahsaniha illa ant, wasrif AAannee sayyi-aha la yasrifu AAannee sayyi-aha illa ant,
details.translations: O Allah, You are the Sovereign, none has the right to be worshipped except You. You are my Lord and I am Your servant, I have wronged my own soul and have acknowledged my sin, so forgive me all my sins for no one forgives sins except You. Guide me to the best of characters for none can guide to it other than You, and deliver me from the worst of characters for none can deliver me from it other than You.

details.arabic: لَبَّيْكَ وَسَعْدَيْكَ، وَالخَيْرُ كُلُّهُ بِيَـدَيْكَ، وَالشَّـرُّ لَيْسَ إِلَيْـكَ، أَنَا بِكَ وَإِلَيْكَ، تَبارَكْتَ وَتَعَالَيْتَ، أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتوبُ إِلَيْكَ
details.transliteration: Labbayka wasaAAdayk,walkhayru kulluhu biyadayk, washsharru laysa ilayk, ana bika wa-ilayk, tabarakta wataAAalayt, astaghfiruka wa-atoobu ilayk.
details.translations: Here I am, in answer to Your call, happy to serve you. All good is within Your hands and evil does not stem from You. I exist by your will and will return to you. Blessed and High are You, I seek Your forgiveness and repent unto You.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/534

pageTitle: At the start of the prayer #3

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ جِبْرَائِيلَ، وَمِيْكَائِيلَ، وَإِسْرَافِيلَ، فَاطِرَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ، عَالِمَ الغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ أَنْتَ تَحْكُمُ بَيْنَ عِبَادِكَ فِيمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ، اهْدِنِي لِمَا اخْتُلِفَ فِيهِ مِنَ الْحَقِّ بِإِذْنِكَ إِنَّكَ تَهْدِي مَنْ تَشَاءُ إِلَى صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقيمٍ
details.transliteration: Allahumma rabba jibra-eel, wameeka-eel, wa-israfeel fatiras-samawati walard, AAalimal-ghaybi washshahadah, anta tahkumu bayna AAibadika feema kanoo feehi yakhtalifoon. ihdinee limakh-tulifa feehi minal-haqqi bi-ithnik, innaka tahdee man tasha-o ila siratin mustaqeem.
details.translations: O Allah, Lord of Jibra-eel, Meeka-eel and Israfeel (great angles), Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Knower of the seen and the unseen. You are the arbitrator between Your servants in that which they have disputed. Guide me to the truth by Your leave, in that which they have differed, for verily You guide whom You will to a straight path.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/534

pageTitle: At the start of the prayer #4

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيرَاً، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً، وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلاً
details.transliteration: Allaahu 'Akbar Kabeera, Allaahu 'Akbar Kabeera, Allaahu 'Akbar Kabeera, walhamdu lillaahi katheera, walhamdu lillaahi katheera, walhamdu lillaahi katheera, wa Subhaanallaahi bukratan wa'aseela.
details.translations: Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Glory is to Allah, at the break of day and at its end.

details.top: ..and then say:
details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ مِنْ نَفْخِهِ، وَنَفْثِهِ، وَهَمْزِهِ،
details.transliteration: A 'oo<u>th</u>u billaahi minash-Shaytaan: min nafkhihi, wa nafthihi, wa hamzihi.
details.translations: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan. From his breath and from his voice and from his whisper.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1/203, Ibn Majah 1/265, ai Ahmad 4/85. Muslim recorded a similar Hadith 1/420

pageTitle: At the start of the prayer #5

details.top: The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) would say [as an opening supplication in prayer] when rising from sleep to perform prayers during the night(Qiyam Al Layl):
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ، أَنْتَ نُورُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ، وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ أَنْتَ قَيِّمُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ، وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ أَنْتَ رَبُّ السَّمَواتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ لَكَ مُلْكُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ أَنْتَ مَلِكُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ
details.transliteration: Allaahwnma lakal-hamdu 'Anta noon samaawaati wal'ardhi wa man feehinna, wa lakal-hamdu 'Anta qayyimus-samaawaati wal'ardhi wa man feehinna. wa lakal-hamdu 'Anta Rabbus-samaawaati wal'ardhi wa man feehinna. wa lakal-hamdu laka mulkus-samaawaati wal'ardhi wa man feehinna. wa lakal-hamdu 'Anta Malikus-samaawaati wal'ardhi
details.translations: O Allah, praise is to You. You are the Light of the heavens and the earth and all that they contain. Praise is to You, You are the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all they contain. Praise is to You, You are the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all they contain. Praise is to You, Yours is dominion of the heavens and the earth and all they contain. Praise is to You, You are the King of the heavens and the earth.

details.arabic: وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ، أَنْتَ الْحَقُّ، وَوَعْدُكَ الْحَقُّ، وَقَوْلُكَ الْحَقُّ، وَلِقَاؤُكَ الْحَقُّ، وَالْجَنَّةُ حَقٌّ، وَالنَّارُ حَقٌّ، وَالنَّبِيُّونَ حَقٌّ، وَمُحَمَّدٌ حَقٌّ، وَالسّاعَةُ حَقٌّ
details.transliteration: wa lakal-hamdu. 'Antal-haqq, wa wa'dukal-haqq, wa qawlukal-haqq wa liqaa'ukal-haqq, waljannatu haqq, wannaaru haqq, wannabiyy oona haqq, wa Muhammadun (sallallaahu 'alayhi wa sallam) haqq, wassaa'atu haqq]
details.translations: And praise is to You. You are the Truth, Your Promise is true, Your Word is true, Your audience is true, Paradise is true, Hell is true, the Prophets are true, and Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) is true, and the Hour of Judgment is true.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ، وَعَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْتُ، وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْتُ، وَبِكَ خَاصَمْتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ حَاكَمْتُ، فَاغْفِرْ لِي مَا قَدَّمْتُ، وَمَا أَخَّرْتُ، وَمَا أَسْرَرْتُ، وَمَا أَعْلَنْتُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma laka 'aslamtu, wa 'alayka tawakkaltu, wa bika 'aamantu, wa 'ilayka 'anabtu, wa bika khaasamtu, wa 'ilayka haakamtu. Faghfir lee maa qaddamtu, wa maa 'akhkhartu, wa maa 'asrartu, wa maa 'a'lantuj.
details.translations: O Allah, to You I have submitted, and upon You I depend. I have believed in You and to You I turn in repentance. For Your sake I dispute and by Your standard I judge. Forgive me what I have sent before me and what I have left behind me, what I have concealed and what I have declared.

details.arabic: أَنْتَ المُقَدِّمُ، وَأَنْتَ المُؤَخِّرُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: 'Antal-Muqaddimu, vua 'Antal-Mu'akhkhiru laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta. '
details.translations: You are the One Who sends forth and You are the One Who delays, there is none who has the right to be worshipped but You.

details.arabic: أَنْتَ إِلَهِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: Anta 'ilaahee laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta.
details.translations: You are my God, there is none who has the right to be worshipped but You.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/3, 11/ 116, 13/371, 423, 465. See also Muslim for a shorter account, 1/532.

pageTitle: When rising from sleep to pray Qiyam al Layl

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الْعَظِيمِ
details.transliteration: Subhaana Rabbiyal-'A<u>dh</u>eem.
details.translations: Glory to my Lord the Exalted
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 870, Ibn Majah 897, An-Nasa'I 1107, At-Tirmithi 262, and Ahmad 3514. See Al-Albani's Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/83.

details.arabic: سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي
details.transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma Rabbanaa wa bihamdika Allaahum-maghfir lee..
details.translations: Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/99, Muslim 1/350

details.arabic: سُبُّوُحٌ، قُدُّوسٌ، رَبُّ المَلاَئِكَةِ وَالرُّوحِ
details.transliteration: Subboohun, Quddoosun, Rabbul-malaa'ikati warrooh..
details.translations: Glory (to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/353, Abu Dawud 1/230

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ رَكَعْتُ، وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ، وَلَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ، خَشَعَ لَكَ سَمْعِي، وَبَصَرِي، وَمُخِّي، وَعَظْمِي، وَعَصَبِي، وَمَا اسْتَقَلَّتْ بِهِ قَدَمِي
details.transliteration: Allaahumma laka raka'tu, wa bika 'aamantu, wa laka 'aslamtu khasha'a laka sam'ee, wa basaree, wa mukhkhee, wa 'a<u>dh</u>mee, wa 'asabee, wa mastaqalla bihi qadamee.
details.translations: O Allah, to You I bow (in prayer) and in You I believe and to You I have submitted. Before You my hearing is humbled, as is my sight, my mind, my bones, my nerves and what my feet have mounted upon (for travel).
details.Reference: Muslim 1/534, Abu Dawud 760-1, An-Nasa'i 1049 and At- Tirmithi 3421. The last line is from ibn Kuzaimah 907

details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ ذِي الْجَبَرُوتِ، وَالْمَلَكُوتِ، وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ، وَالْعَظَمَةِ
details.transliteration: Subhaana <u>th</u>il-jabarooti, walmalakooti, walkibriyaa'i, wal'a<u>dh</u>amati.
details.translations: Glory is to You, Master of power, of dominion, of majesty and greatness.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1/230, An-Nasa'i and Ahmad. Its chain of narration is good (Hasan)

details.arabic: سَمِعَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ حَمِدَهُ
details.transliteration: Sami'allaahu liman hamidah
details.translations: Allah hears whoever praises Him.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/282

details.arabic: رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ، حَمْداً كَثِيراً  طَيِّباً مُبارَكاً فِيهِ
details.transliteration: Rabbanaa wa lakal-hamd, hamdan i katheeran tayyiban mubaarakanfeeh.
details.translations: Our Lord, praise is Yours, abundant, good and blessed praise.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/284

details.arabic: مِلْءَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَمِلْءَ الأَرْضِ، وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا، وَمِلْءَ مَا شِئْتَ مِنْ شَيءٍ بَعْدُ، أَهْلَ الثَّنَاءِ وَالْمَجْدِ، أَحَقُّ مَا قَالَ الْعَبْدُ، وَكُلُّنَا لَكَ عَبْدٌ، اللَّهُمَّ لاَ مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلاَ مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلاَ يَنْفَعُ ذَا الجَدِّ مِنْكَ الجَدُّ
details.transliteration: Mil'as-samaawaati wa mU'al-'ardhi wa maa baynahumaa, wa mil'a maa shi'ta min shay 'in ba'd. 'Ahlath-thanaa'i walmajdi, 'ahaqqu maa qaalal-'abdu, wa kullunaa laka 'abdun. Allaahumma laa maani'a limaa 'a'tayta, wa laa mu'tiya limaa mana'ta, wa laa yanfa'u<u>th</u>al-jaddi minkal-jadd.
details.translations: (A praise that) fills the heavens and the earth and what lies between them, and whatever else You please. (You Allah) are most worthy of praise and majesty, and what the slave has said - we are all Your slaves. O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld. And the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/346

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الأَعْلَى
details.transliteration: Subhaana Rabbiyal-A 'laa.
details.translations: Glory is to my Lord, the Most High.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, and Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/83.

details.arabic: سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي
details.transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma Rabbanaa wa bihamdika Allaahum-maghfir lee.
details.translations: Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 794 and Muslim 868, see invocation no. 19.3 next.

details.arabic: سُبُّوحٌ، قُدُّوسٌ، رَبُّ الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَالرُّوحِ
details.transliteration: Subboohun, Quddoosun, Rabbul-malaa'ikati warrooh.
details.translations: Glory (to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/533, see invocation no. 19.4 next.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لَكَ سَجَدْتُ وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ، وَلَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ، سَجَدَ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي خَلَقَهُ، وَصَوَّرَهُ، وَشَقَّ سَمْعَهُ وَبَصَرَهُ، تَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحْسنُ الْخَالِقِينَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma laka sajadtu wa bika 'aamantu, wa laka 'aslamtu, sajada wajhiya lilla<u>th</u>ee khalaqahu, wa sawwarahu, wa shaqqa sam'ahu wa basarahu, tabaarakallaahu 'ahsanul-khaaliqeen.
details.translations: O Allah, to You I prostrate myself and in You I believe. To You I have submitted. My face is prostrated to the One Who created it, fashioned it, and gave it hearing and sight. Blessed is Allah, the Best of creators
details.Reference: Muslim 1/534 and others.

details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ ذِي الْجَبَرُوتِ، وَالْمَلَكُوتِ، وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ، وَالْعَظَمَةِ
details.transliteration: Subhaana <u>th</u>il-jabarooti, walmalakooti, walkibriyaa'i, wal'a<u>dh</u>amati.
details.translations: Glory is to You, Master of power, of dominion, of majesty and greatness.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1/230, An-Nasa'i, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Abu Dawud 1/166

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي ذَنْبِي كُلَّهُ، دِقَّهُ وَجِلَّهُ، وَأَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ، وَعَلاَنِيَّتَهُ وَسِرَّهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maghfir lee <u>th</u>anbee kullahu, diqqahu wa jillahu, wa 'awwalahu wa 'aakhirahu wa 'alaaniyata hu wa sirrahu.
details.translations: O Allah, forgive me all my sins, great and small, the first and the last, those that are apparent and those that are hidden..
details.Reference: Muslim 1/350

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِرِضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ، وَبِمُعَافَاتِكَ مِنْ عُقُوبَتِكَ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْكَ، لاَ أُحْصِي ثَنَاءً عَلَيْكَ، أَنْتَ كَمَا أَثْنَيْتَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u biridhaaka min sakhatika, wa bimu'aafaatika min 'uqoobatika wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minka, laa 'uhsee thanaa'an 'alayka 'Anta kamaa 'athnayta 'alaa nafsika.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek protection in Your pleasure from Your anger, and I seek protection in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek protection in You from You. I cannot count Your praises. You are as You have praised Yourself.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/352

details.arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي، رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي
details.transliteration: Rabbighfir lee, Rabbighfir lee..
details.translations: Lord, forgive me. My Lord, forgive me.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1/231. See also Al-Albani, Sahihibn Mdjah 1/148

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَاجْبُرْنِي، وَعَافِنِي، وَارْزُقْنِي، وَارْفَعْنِي
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maghfir lee, warhamnee, wahdinee, wajburnee, wa 'aafinee, warzuqnee, warfa'nee.
details.translations: O Allah forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, support me, protect me, provide for me and elevate me.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1/231, Ibn Majah 898, At-Tirmithi 284-5. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/90 and Sahih Ibn Majah 1/148.

details.arabic: سَجَدَ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي خَلَقَهُ، وَشَقَّ سَمْعَهُ وَبَصَرَهُ بِحَوْلِهِ وَقُوَّتِهِ، فَتَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِينَ
details.transliteration: Sajada wajhiya lilla<u>th</u>ee khalaqahu, wa shaqqa sam'ahu wa basarahu bihawlihi wa quwwatihi. Fatabaarakallaahu 'ahsanul-khaaliqeen.
details.translations: I have prostrated my face to the One Who created it, and gave it hearing and sight by His might and His power. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 2/474, Ahmad 6/30, and Al-Hakim

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اكْتُبْ لِي بِهَا عِنْدَكَ أَجْراً، وَضَعْ عَنِّي بِهَا وِزْراً، وَاجْعَلْهَا لِي عِنْدَكَ ذُخْراً، وَتَقَبَّلْهَا مِنِّي كَمَا تَقَبَّلْتَهَا مِنْ عَبْدِكَ دَاوُدَ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maktub lee bihaa 'indaka 'ajran, wa aha' 'annee bihaa wizran, waj'alhaa lee 'indaka <u>th</u>ukhran, wa taqabbalhaa minnee kamaa taqabbaltahaa min'abdika Daawooda.
details.translations: O Allah, write it as a reward for me, and release me from a burden for it, and make it a I treasure for me in Paradise. Accept it from me as You accepted it from your servant Dawud.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 2/473, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/219.

details.arabic: التَّحِيَّاتُ لِلَّهِ، وَالصَّلَواتُ، وَالطَّيِّباتُ، السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ، السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى عِبَادِ اللَّهِ الصَّالِحِينَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ
details.transliteration: Attahiyyaatu lillaahi wassalawaatu, wattayyibaatu, assalaamu 'alayka 'ayyuhan-Nabiyyu wa rahmatullaahi wa barakaatuhu, assalaamu 'alaynaa wa 'alaa 'ibaadillaahis-saaliheen. 'Ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluhu.
details.translations: All greetings of humility are for Allah, and all prayers and goodness. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous slaves of Allah. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, from Al-Asqalani,Fathul-Bal 1/13, Muslim 1/301.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ، وَعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، كَمَا صَلَّيتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيمَ، وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيدٌ، اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، كَمَا بَارَكْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيدٌ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma salli 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa sallayta 'alaa 'Ibraaheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed. Allaahumma baarik 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa baarakta 'alaa 'Ibraaheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed.
details.translations: O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad and on the family of Muhammad as You have bestowed Your favor on Ibrahim and on the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious. O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You have blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, from Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/408

pageTitle: Prayers upon the Prophet after tashahhud #1

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَى أَزْوَاجِهِ وَذُرِّيَّتِهِ، كَمَا صَلَّيْتَ عَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، وَبَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَى أَزْوَاجِهِ وَذُرِّيَّتِهِ، كَمَا بَارَكْتَ عَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيدٌ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma salli 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'azwaajihi wa <u>th</u>urriyyatihi, kamaa sallayta 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema. Wa baarik 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'azwaajihi wa <u>th</u>urriyyatihi, kamaa baarakta 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema. 'Innaka Hameedun Majeed.
details.translations: O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad and upon his wives and progeny as You have bestowed Your favor upon the family of Ibrahim. And bless Muhammad and his wives and progeny as You have blessed the family of Ibrahim, You are full of praise, Most Glorious.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, from Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/ 407, Muslim 1/306

pageTitle: Prayers upon the Prophet after tashahhud #2

details.arabic: اللَّهُــمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، وَمِنْ عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ، وَمِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min l'a<u>th</u>aabil-qabri, wa min 'a<u>th</u>aabi jahannama, wa min fitnatil-mahyaa walmamaati, wa min sharri fitnatil-maseehid-dajjaal.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave, and from the punishment of Hell-fire, and from the trials of life and death, and from the evil of the trial of the False Messiah.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 2/102, Muslim 1/412, and this is Muslim's wording.

pageTitle: Protection from punishment of the grave, trials of life, death & Dajjal

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْـيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ . اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْمَأْثَمِ وَالْمَغْرَمِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min 'a<u>th</u>aabil-qabri, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min fitnatil-maseehid-dajjaali, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min fitnatil-mahyaa walmamaati. Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minal-ma'thami walmaghrami.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave, and I seek refuge in You from the trial of the False Messiah, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of life and death. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from sin and from debt.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/202, Muslim 1/412

pageTitle: Protection from punishment of the grave, trials of life, death & Dajjal, from sin & debt

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي ظُلْماً كَثِيراً، وَلاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، فَاغْفِرْ لِي مَغْفِرَةً مِنْ عِنْدِكَ وَارْحَمْنِي، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee dhalamtu nafsee <u>dh</u>ulman katheeran, wa laa yaghfiru<u>th</u>-<u>th</u>unooba 'illaa 'Anta, faghfir lee maghfiratan min 'indika warhamnee 'innaka 'Antal-Ghafoorur-Raheem.
details.translations: O Allah, I have greatly wronged myself and no one forgives sins but You. So, grant me forgiveness and have mercy on me. Surely, you are Forgiving, Merciful.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 8/168, Muslim 4/2078.

pageTitle: After the last tashahhud & before salam #3

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي مَا قَدَّمْتُ، وَمَا أَخَّرْتُ، وَمَا أَسْرَرْتُ، وَمَا أَعْلَنْتُ، وَمَا أَسْرَفْتُ، وَمَا أَنْتَ أَعْلَمُ بِهِ مِنِّي، أَنْتَ الْمُقَدِّمُ، وَأَنْتَ الْمُؤَخِّرُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maghfir lee maa qaddamtu, wa maa 'akhkhartu, wa maa 'asrartu, wa maa 'a'lantu, wa maa 'asraftu, wa maa 'Anta 'a'lamu bihi minnee. 'Antal-Muqaddimu, wa 'Antal-Mu'akhkhiru laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta.
details.translations: O Allah, forgive me what I have sent before me and what I have left behind me, what I have concealed and what I have done openly, what I have done in excess, and what You are better aware of than I. You are the One Who sends forth and You are the One Who delays. There is none worthy of worship but You.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/534.

pageTitle: After the last tashahhud & before salam #4

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّي عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ، وَشُكْرِكَ، وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'a'innee 'alaa <u>th</u>ikrika, wa shukrika, wahusni 'ibaadatika.
details.translations: O Allah, help me to remember You, to give You thanks, and to perform Your worship in the best manner.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/86, An-Nasa'i 3/53. See also Al-Albani Sahih Abu Dawud 1 /284

pageTitle: After the last tashahhud & before salam #5

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبُخْلِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْجُبْنِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ أَنْ أُرَدَّ إِلَى أَرْذَلِ الْعُمُرِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الدُّنْيَا وَعَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minal-bukhli, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minal-jubni, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min 'an 'uradda 'ilaa 'ar<u>th</u>alil-'umuri, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min fitnatid-dunyaa wa 'a<u>th</u>aabil-qabri..
details.translations: O Allah, I seek Your protection from miserliness, I seek Your protection from cowardice, and I seek Your protection from being returned to feeble old age. I seek Your protection from the trials of this world and from the torment of the grave.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/35

pageTitle: Protection from misery, cowardice, old age and trials

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-jannata wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minan-naar.
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and seek Your protection from the Fire.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 792. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/328

pageTitle: Ask for paradise & protection from fire

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بِعِلْمِكَ الغَيْبَ وَقُدْرَتِكَ عَلَى الْخَلْقِ أَحْيِنِي مَا عَلِمْتَ الْحَيَاةَ خَيْراً لِي، وَتَوَفَّنِي إِذَا عَلِمْتَ الْوَفَاةَ خَيْراً لِي، اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَشْيَتَكَ فِي الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma bi'ilmikal-ghayba wa qudratika 'alal-khalqi 'ahyinee maa 'alimtal-hayaata khayran lee wa tawaffanee 'i<u>th</u>aa 'alimtal-wafaata khayran lee, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khashyataka fil-ghaybi wash-shahaadati,
details.translations: O Allah, by Your Knowledge of the unseen and by Your Power over creation, let me live if You know that life is good for me, and let me die if You know that death is good for me. O Allah, I ask You to grant me fear of You in private and in public.

details.arabic: وَأَسْأَلُكَ كَلِمَةَ الْحَقِّ فِي الرِّضَا وَالْغَضَبِ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ الْقَصْدَ فِي الْغِنَى وَالْفَقْرِ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ نَعِيماً لاَ يَنْفَدُ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ قُرَّةَ عَيْنٍ لاَ تَنْقَطِعُ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ الرِّضَا بَعْدَ الْقَضَاءِ
details.transliteration: wa 'as'aluka kalimatal-haqqi fir-ridhaa walghadhabi, wa 'as'alukal-qasda fil-ghinaa walfaqri, wa 'as'aluka na'eeman laa yanfadu, wa 'as'aluka qurrata 'aynin laa tanqati'u, wa 'as'alukar-ridhaa ba'dal-qadhaa'i,
details.translations: I ask you for the word of truth in times of contentment and anger. I ask You for moderation in wealth and in poverty. I ask you for blessings never ceasing and the coolness of my eye (i.e. pleasure) that never ends.

details.arabic: وَأَسْــــأَلُكَ بَرْدَ الْعَيْشِ بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ لَذَّةَ النَّظَرِ إِلَى وَجْهِكَ، وَالشَّوْقَ إِلَى لِقائِكَ فِي غَيرِ ضَرَّاءَ مُضِرَّةٍ، وَلاَ فِتْنَةٍ مُضِلَّةٍ، اللَّهُمَّ زَيِّنَا بِزِينَةِ الإِيمَانِ، وَاجْعَلْنَا هُدَاةً مُهْتَدِينَ
details.transliteration: wa 'as'aluka bardal-'ayshi ba'dal-mawti, wa 'as'aluka la<u>thth</u>atan-na<u>dh</u>ari 'ilaa wajhika wash-shawqa 'ilaa liqaa'ikafee ghayri dharraa'a mudhirratin wa laa fitnatin mudhillatin, Allaahumma zayyinnaa bizeenatil-'eemaani waj'alnaa hudaatan muhtadeen..
details.translations: I ask You for pleasure after Your Judgment and I ask You for a life of coolness after death. I ask You for the delight of gazing upon Your Face and the joy of meeting You without any harm and misleading trials befalling me. O Allah, dress us with the beauty of Faith, and make us guides who are upon (correct) guidance.
details.Reference: An-Nasa'i 3/54, 55, Ahmad 4/364. See also Al-Albani, Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/281.

pageTitle: After the last tashahhud & before salam #8

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ يَا أَللَّهُ بِأَنَّكَ الْوَاحِدُ الْأَحَدُ الصَّمَدُ الَّذِي لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ، وَلَمْ يَكنْ لَهُ كُفُواً أَحَدٌ، أَنْ تَغْفِرَ لِي ذُنُوبِي إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِّيمُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka yaaAllaahu bi'annakal-Waahidul-'Ahadus-Samadul-lathee, lam yalid wa lam yoolad, wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'Ahad, 'an taghfira lee <u>th</u>unoobee 'innaka 'Antal-Ghafoorur-Raheem..
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You. O Allah, You are the One, the Only, Self-Sufficient Master, Who was not begotten and begets not and none is equal to Him. Forgive me my sins, surely you are Forgiving, Merciful.
details.Reference: An-Nasa'i 3/52, Ahmad 4/338. See also Al-Albani, Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/280 and Sifat Salatun-Nabi, pg. 204

pageTitle: After the last tashahhud & before salam #9

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ، الْمَنَّانُ، يَا بَدِيعَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ، يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka bi'anna lakal-hamda laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta wahdaka laa shareeka laka, Al-Mannaanu, yaa Badee'as-samaawaati wal'ardhi yaa <u>Th</u>al-Jalaali wal-'Ikraam, yaa Hayyu yaa Qayyoomu 'innee 'as'alukal-jannata wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minan-naar.
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You, as You are the Owner of praise, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partner. You are the Giver of all good. O Creator of the heavens and the earth, Owner of majesty and honor. O Living and Everlasting One, I ask you for Paradise and I seek refuge in You from the fire.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1495, An-Nasa'I 1299, Ibn Majah 3858, At-Tirmithi 1344. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/329

pageTitle: After the last tashahhud & before salam #10

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنِّي أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ الْأَحَدُ الصَّمَدُ الَّذِي لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُواً أَحَدٌ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka bi'annee 'ash-hadu 'annaka 'Antallaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Antal-'Ahadus-Samadul-la<u>th</u>ee lam yalid wa lam yoolad wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'Ahad..
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You, by the fact that I bear witness that You are Allah. There is none worthy of worship but You, the Only God, Independent of creation, Who was not begotten and begets not, and none is equal to Him.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/62, Ibn Majah 2/1267, At-Tirmithi 5/515, Ahmad 5/360. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/329 and Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/163

pageTitle: After the last tashahhud & before salam #11

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ
details.transliteration: 'Astaghfirullaaha
details.translations: I ask Allaah for forgiveness.

details.top: Then say:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلاَمُ، وَمِنْكَ السَّلاَمُ، تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Antas-Salaamu wa minkas-salaamu, tabaarakta yaa <u>Th</u>al-Jalaali wal-'Ikraam
details.translations: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Owner of majesty and honor.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/414.

details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ،
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer,
details.translations: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لاَ مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلاَ مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلاَ يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الجَدُّ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma laa maard'a limaa 'a'tayta, wa laa mu'tiya limaa mana'ta, wa laa yanfa'u <u>th</u>al-jaddi minkal-jadd.
details.translations: O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld; and the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/255, Muslim 1/414

details.arabic: لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَلاَ نَعْبُدُ إِلاَّ إِيَّاهُ، لَهُ النِّعْمَةُ وَلَهُ الْفَضْلُ وَلَهُ الثَّنَاءُ الْحَسَنُ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الكَافِرُونَ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku, wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay 'in Qadeer. Laa hawla wa laa quwwata 'illaa billaahi, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu, wa laa na'budu 'illaa 'iyyaahu, lahun-ni'matu wa lahul-fadhlu wa lahuth-thanaa'ul-hasanu, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu mukhliseena lahud-deena wa law karihal-kaafiroon
details.translations: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise and He is Able to do all things. There is no power and no might except by Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah, and we do not worship any other besides Him. His is grace, and His is bounty and to Him belongs the most excellent praise. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah. (We are) sincere in making our religious devotion to Him, even though the disbelievers may dislike it.
details.Reference: Muslim 1/415.

details.top: Say thirty-three times each
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
details.transliteration: Subhaanallaahi, walhamdu lillaahi wallaahu 'Akbar,
details.translations: How perfect Allaah is, all praise is for Allaah, and Allaah is the greatest.

details.top: ...and then say:
details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamduwaHuwa'alaakullishay'inQadeer.
details.translations: None has the right to be worshipped except Allaah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent.
details.bottom: Whoever says these after every prayer will be forgiven his sins even though they be as the foam of the sea
details.Reference: Muslim 1/418

pageTitle: Sins forgiven even if like the foam of the sea

details.top:
The following three Soorahs should be recited once after Zuhr, 'Asr and 'Ishaa prayers and thrice after the Fajr and Maghrib prayers.

1.Soorah al-Ikhlaas(112):
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ ﴿١﴾ اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ ﴿٢﴾ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ ﴿٣﴾ وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ ﴿٤﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul Huwallaahu 'Ahad. Allaahus-Samad. Lam yalid wa lam yoolad. Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'ahad.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: He is Allah (the) One. The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He begets not nor was He begotten, and there is none equal to Him

details.top: 2.Soorah al-Falaq(113):
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَ‌بِّ الْفَلَقِ ﴿١﴾ مِن شَرِّ‌ مَا خَلَقَ ﴿٢﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ ﴿٣﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ ﴿٤﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ ﴿٥﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul 'a'oo<u>th</u>u birabbil-falaq. Min sharri maa khalaq. Wa min sharri ghaasiqin 'i<u>th</u>aa waqab. Wa min sharrin-naffaathaati fil-'uqad. Wa min sharri haasidin 'i<u>th</u>aa hasad.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak, from the evil of what He has created, and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness, and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots, and from the evil of the envier when he envies.

details.top: 3. Soorah al-Naas:(114)
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَ‌بِّ النَّاسِ ﴿١﴾ مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ﴿٢﴾ إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ ﴿٣﴾ مِن شَرِّ‌ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ ﴿٤﴾ الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ‌ النَّاسِ ﴿٥﴾ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ ﴿٦﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul 'a'oo<u>th</u>u birabbin-naas. Malikin-naas. 'Ilaahin-naas. Min sharril-waswaasil-khannaas. Alla<u>th</u>ee yuwaswisu fee sudoorin-naas. Minal-jinnati wannaas.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, who whispers in the breasts of mankind, of jinns and men.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/86, An-Nasa'i 3/68. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmithi 2/8.

pageTitle: Last three Surahs of the Quran

details.top: Whoever recites Aayat al-Kursiy immediately after each prescribed prayer, there will be nothing standing between him and his entering Paradise except death.
details.arabic: اللَّهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَىُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ
details.transliteration: Allaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwal-Hayyul-Qayyoom,
details.translations: Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists.

details.arabic: لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ
details.transliteration: laa ta'khu<u>th</u>uhu sinatun wa laa nawm,
details.translations: Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him.

details.arabic: لَّهُ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ۗ
details.transliteration: lahu maa fis-samaawaati wa maafil-'ardh,
details.translations: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.

details.arabic: مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ
details.transliteration: man <u>th</u>al-la<u>th</u>ee yashfa'u 'indahu 'illaa bi'<u>ith</u>nih,
details.translations: Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission?

details.arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ
details.transliteration: ya'lamu maa bayna 'aydeehim wa maa khalfahum,
details.translations: He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter.

details.arabic: وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ
details.transliteration: wa laa yuheetoona bishay'im-min 'ilmihi 'illaa bimaa shaa'a,
details.translations: And they will never compass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills.

details.arabic: وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ
details.transliteration: wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samaawaati wal'ardh,
details.translations: His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth,

details.arabic: وَلاَ يَؤُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ
details.transliteration: wa laa ya'ooduhu hif<u>dh</u>uhumaa,
details.translations: and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them.

details.arabic: وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيمُ
details.transliteration: wa Huwal-'Aliyyul- 'A<u>dh</u>eem.
details.translations: And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
details.bottom: Soorah al-Baqarah: Ayah(255)
details.Reference: An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (Hadith no. 100), also Ibn As-Sunni (no. 121). See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/339 and Silsilatul-Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/697 (no. 972).

details.top: Recite ten times after the Maghrib and Fajr prayers.
details.arabic: لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu yuhyee wa yumeetu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
details.translations: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise. He brings life and He causes death, and He is Able to do all things.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 5/515, Ahmad 4/227. See its checking in Ibn Al-Qayyim Al-Jawziyyah's Zddul-Ma'ad 1/300

details.top: Recite in Arabic after the Fajr prayer.
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka 'ilman naafi'an, wa rizqan tayyiban, wa 'amalan mutaqabbalan.
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You for knowledge that is of benefit, a good provision, and deeds that will be accepted.
details.Reference: Ibn Majah and others. See Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Ma,null,jah 1/152 and Majma'uz-Zawd'id 10/111.

pageTitle: Asking for Beneficial Knowledge, Pure Rizq & Accepted Deeds

details.top:
On the authority of Jaabir Ibn 'Adbullaah (radhi-yAllaahu 'anhu), he said: The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) would instruct us to pray for guidance in all of our concerns, just as he would teach us a Soorah from the Quran.

He would say:'If any of you intends to undertake a matter then let him pray two supererogatory units [two rak'ah naafilah] of prayer and after which he should supplicate:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْتَخِيرُكَ بِعِلْمِكَ، وَأَسْتَقْدِرُكَ بِقُدْرَتِكَ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ العَظِيمِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'astakheeruka bi'ilmika, wa 'astaqdiruka biqudratika, wa 'as'aluka min fadhtikal-'A<u>dh</u>eemi,
details.translations: O Allah, I seek the counsel of Your Knowledge, and I seek the help of Your Omnipotence,

details.arabic: فَإِنَّكَ تَقْدِرُ وَلاَ أَقْدِرُ، وَتَعْلَمُ وَلاَ أَعْلَمُ، وَأَنْتَ عَلاَّمُ الغُيُوبِ
details.transliteration: fa'innaka taqdiru wa laa 'aqdiru, wa ta'lamu, wa laa 'a'lamu, wa 'Anta 'Allaamul-Ghuyoobi,
details.translations: and I beseech You for Your Magnificent Grace. Surely, You are Capable and I am not. You know and I know not, and You are the Knower of the unseen.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الأمْرَ (وَيُسَمِّي حَاجَتَهُ) خَيْرٌ لِي فِي دِينِي وَمَعَاشِي وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِي، فَاقْدُرْهُ لِي وَيَسِّرْهُ لِي ثُمَّ بَارِكْ لِي فِيهِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'in kunta ta'lamu 'anna haa<u>th</u>al-'amra- [then mention the thing to be decided] Khayrun lee fee deenee wa ma'aashee wa 'aaqibati 'amree - [or say] 'Aajilihi wa 'aajilihi - Faqdurhu lee wa yassirhu lee thumma baarik lee feehi,
details.translations: O Allah, if You know that this matter [then mention the thing to be decided] is good for me in my religion and in my life and for my welfare in the life to come, - [or say: in this life and the afterlife] - then ordain it for me and make it easy for me, then bless me in it.

details.arabic: وَإِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الْأَمْرَ شَرٌّ لِي فِي دِينِي وَمَعَاشِي وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِي فَاصْرِفْهُ عَنِّي وَاصْرِفْنِي عَنْهُ وَاقْدُرْ لِيَ الْخَيْرَ حَيْثُ كَانَ، ثُمَّ أَرْضِنِي بِهِ
details.transliteration: wa 'in kunta ta'lamu 'anna haa<u>th</u>al-'amra sharrun lee fee deenee wa ma'aashee wa 'aaqibati 'amree - [or say] 'Aajilihi wa 'aajilihi - Fasrifhu 'annee wasrifnee 'anhu waqdur liyal-khayra haythu kaana thumma 'ardhinee bihi.
details.translations: And if You know that this matter is bad for me in my religion and in my life and for my welfare in the life to come, - [or say: in this life and the afterlife] - then distance it from me, and distance me from it, and ordain for me what is good wherever it may be, and help me to be content with it.

details.top: Whoever seeks the counsel of the Creator will not regret it and whoever seeks the advice of the believers will feel confident about his decisions. Allah said in the Qur'an:
details.arabic: وَشَاوِرْهُمْ فِي الْاَمْرِ ۚ فَاِذَا عَزَمْتَ فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَي اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: washawirhum fee al-amrifa-itha AAazamta fatawakkal AAala Allahi
details.translations: ...and consult them in the affair. Then when you have taken a decision put your trust in Allaah...
details.bottom: Soorah aal Imraan 3: 159
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/162

pageTitle: Istikharah (Seeking Allah's help in making a decision)

details.top:
All praise is for Allaah, alone, and prayers and peace be upon the last and final Prophet.

Anas (RA) said that he heard the Prophet (SAW) say: "That I sit with people remembering Almighty Allah from the morning (Fajr) prayer until sunrise is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves from among the Children of Isma'il.

That I sit with people remembering Allah from the afternoon ('Asr) prayer until the sun sets is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves from among the Children of Isma'il."
details.Reference: This was reported by Abu Dawud (no. 3667). Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/698.

pageTitle: Excellence of dua in the morning & evening

details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
details.transliteration: A 'oothu billaahi minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
details.translations: I take refuge with Allaah from the accursed devil.

details.top: Then recite Aayatul-Kursee:
details.arabic: اللَّهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَىُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ
details.transliteration: Allaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwal-Hayyul-Qayyoom,
details.translations: Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists.

details.arabic: لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ
details.transliteration: laa ta'khu<u>th</u>uhu sinatun wa laa nawm,
details.translations: Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him.

details.arabic: لَّهُ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ۗ
details.transliteration: lahu maa fis-samaawaati wa maafil-'ardh,
details.translations: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.

details.arabic: مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ
details.transliteration: man <u>th</u>al-la<u>th</u>ee yashfa'u 'indahu 'illaa bi'<u>ith</u>nih,
details.translations: Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission?

details.arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ
details.transliteration: ya'lamu maa bayna 'aydeehim wa maa khalfahum,
details.translations: He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter.

details.arabic: وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ
details.transliteration: wa laa yuheetoona bishay'im-min 'ilmihi 'illaa bimaa shaa'a,
details.translations: And they will never compass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills.

details.arabic: وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ
details.transliteration: wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samaawaati wal'ardh,
details.translations: His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth,

details.arabic: وَلاَ يَؤُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ
details.transliteration: wa laa ya'ooduhu hif<u>dh</u>uhumaa,
details.translations: and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them.

details.arabic: وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيمُ
details.transliteration: wa Huwal-'Aliyyul- 'A<u>dh</u>eem.
details.translations: And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
details.bottom:
Soorah al-Baqarah: Ayah(255)

Whoever says this when he rises in the morning will be protected from jinns until he retires in the evening. And whoever says it when he retires in the evening will be protected from them until he rises in the morning.
details.Reference: Al-Hakim 1 / 562, Sahih at-Targhib wa at-Tarhib 1/273, at-Tabarani.

details.top:
To get protection against anything, recite three times the Last three Surahs of the Quran:

1.Soorah al-Ikhlaas(112):
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ ﴿١﴾ اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ ﴿٢﴾ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ ﴿٣﴾ وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ ﴿٤﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul Huwallaahu 'Ahad. Allaahus-Samad. Lam yalid wa lam yoolad. Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'ahad.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: He is Allah (the) One. The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He begets not nor was He begotten, and there is none equal to Him

details.top: 2.Soorah al-Falaq(113):
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَ‌بِّ الْفَلَقِ ﴿١﴾ مِن شَرِّ‌ مَا خَلَقَ ﴿٢﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ ﴿٣﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ ﴿٤﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ ﴿٥﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul 'a'oo<u>th</u>u birabbil-falaq. Min sharri maa khalaq. Wa min sharri ghaasiqin 'i<u>th</u>aa waqab. Wa min sharrin-naffaathaati fil-'uqad. Wa min sharri haasidin 'i<u>th</u>aa hasad.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak, from the evil of what He has created, and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness, and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots, and from the evil of the envier when he envies.

details.top: 3. Soorah al-Naas:(114)
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَ‌بِّ النَّاسِ ﴿١﴾ مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ﴿٢﴾ إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ ﴿٣﴾ مِن شَرِّ‌ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ ﴿٤﴾ الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ‌ النَّاسِ ﴿٥﴾ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ ﴿٦﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul 'a'oo<u>th</u>u birabbin-naas. Malikin-naas. 'Ilaahin-naas. Min sharril-waswaasil-khannaas. Alla<u>th</u>ee yuwaswisu fee sudoorin-naas. Minal-jinnati wannaas.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, who whispers in the breasts of mankind, of jinns and men.
details.bottom: Whoever recites these Three times in the morning and in the evening, they will suffice him (as a protection) against everything.
details.Reference: Al-Ikhlas:1-4. Al-Falaq:1-5. An-Nas:1-6, Abu Dawud 4/322, At-Tirmizi 5/567, Sahih At-Tirmizi 3/182.

pageTitle: Dua that will suffice one (as a protection) against everything

details.top: In the morning (evening) say,
