details.arabic: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ (أَمْسَيْنَا وَ أَمْسَىا) الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِي هَذَا الْيَوْمِ (هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ) وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهُ (بَعْدَهَا)، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِي هَذَا الْيَوْمِ (هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ) وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ (بَعْدَهَا)، رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِي النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِي الْقَبْرِ
details.transliteration: Asbahnaa wa 'asbahal-mulku ('Amsaynaa wa'amsal-mulku) lillaahi walhamdu lillaahi, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer. Rabbi 'as'aluka khayra maa fee haathal-yawmi (haathihil-laylati) wa khayra maa ba'dahu (ba'daha) wa 'a'oothu bika min sharri maa fee haathal-yawmi (haathihil-laylati) wa sharri maa ba'dahu (ba'daha), Rabbi 'a'oothu bika minal-kasali, wa soo'il-kibari, Rabbi 'a'oothu bika min 'athaabin fin-naari wa 'athaabin fil-qabri.
details.translations: We have reached the morning (evening) and at this very time unto Allaah, belongs all sovereignty, and all praise is for Allaah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allaah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. My Lord, I ask You for the good of this day (night) and the good of what follows it and I take refuge in You from the evil of this day (night) and the evil of what follows it. My Lord, I take refuge in You from laziness and senility. My Lord, I take refuge in You from torment in the Fire and punishment in the grave.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/2088.

details.top: In the morning:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُورُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma bika 'asbahnaa , wa bika 'amsaynaa, wa bika nahyaa, wa bika namootu wa 'ilaykan-nushoor.
details.translations: O Allah, by You we enter the morning and by You we enter the evening, by You we live and and by You we die, and to You is our resurrection

details.top: In the evening, say:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوْتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيْرُ.
details.transliteration: Allaahumma bika 'amsaynaa, wa bika 'asbahnaa, wa bika nahyaa, wa bika namootu wa 'ilaykan-nushoor.
details.translations: O Allah, by You we enter the evening and by You we enter the morning, by You we live and and by You we die, and to You is our resurrection
details.Reference: Sahih At-Tirmizi 3/142.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Anta Rabbee laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, khalaqtanee wa 'anaa 'abduka,
details.translations: O Allaah, You are my Lord, none has the right to be worshipped except You, You created me and I am Your servant

details.arabic: وَأَنَا عَلَى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ
details.transliteration: wa 'anaa 'alaa 'ahdika wa wa'dika mas-tata'tu, 'a'oothu bika min sharri maa sana'tu,
details.translations: and I abide to Your covenant and promise as best I can, I take refuge in You from the evil of which I have committed.

details.arabic: أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ، وَأَبُوءُ بِذَنْبِي
details.transliteration: a'oothu bika min sharri maa sana'tu, 'aboo'u laka bini'matika 'alayya, wa 'aboo'u bithanbee
details.translations: I acknowledge Your favour upon me and I acknowledge my sin,

details.arabic: فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: faghfir lee fa'innahu laa yaghfiruth-thunooba 'illaa 'Anta.
details.translations: so forgive me, for verily none can forgive sin except You.
details.bottom: Whoever recites this with conviction in the evening and dies during that night shall enter Paradise, and whoever recites it with conviction in the morning and dies during that day shall enter Paradise
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/150, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmizi.

pageTitle: Sayyidinal Istighfar (Best way to ask forgiveness)

details.top: Four times in the morning(evening) say
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنّيْ أَصْبَحْتُ (أَمْسَيْتُ) أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلاَئِكَتِكَ، وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'asbahtu ('amsaytu) 'ush-hiduka wa 'ush-hidu hamalata 'arshika, wa malaa'ikataka wajamee'a khalqika, 'annaka 'Antallaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta wahdaka laa shareeka laka, wa 'anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa Rasooluka.
details.translations: O Allaah, verily I have reached the morning (evening) and call on You, the bearers of Your throne, Your angels, and all of Your creation to witness that You are Allaah, none has the right to be worshipped except You, alone, without any partner and that Muhammad is Your Servant and Messenger.'
details.bottom: Allah will spare whoever says this four times in the morning or evening from the fire of Hell
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/317, An-Nasa'i, Ibn As-Sunni.

details.top: In the morning (evening) say,
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ مَا أَصْبَحَ (أَمْسَى) بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma maa 'asbaha ('amsaa) bee min ni'matin 'aw bi'ahadin min khalqika faminka wahdaka laa shareeka laka, falakal-hamdu wa lakash-shukru.
details.translations: O Allaah, what blessing I have received in this morning (evening) or any of Your creation, is from You alone, without any partner, so for You is all praise and unto You all thanks.
details.bottom: Whoever recites this in the morning, has completed his obligation to thank Allah for that day; and whoever says it in the evening, has completed his obligation for that night
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/318, Ibn As-Sunni (Hadith no. 41), Ibn Hibban (Hadith no. 2361).

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَدَنِي، اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي سَمْعِي، اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَصَرِي، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُفْرِ، وَالفَقْرِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ القَبْرِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'aafinee fee badanee, Allaahumma 'aafinee fee sam'ee, Allaahumma 'aafinee fee basaree, laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta. Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oothu bika minal-kufri, walfaqri, wa 'a'oothu bika min 'athaabil-qabri, laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta.
details.translations: O Allaah, grant my body health, O Allaah, grant my hearing health, O Allaah, grant my sight health. None has the right to be worshipped except You. O Allaah, I take refuge with You from disbelief and poverty, and I take refuge with You from the punishment of the grave. None has the right to be worshipped except You.'
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42, An-Nasa'i, Ibn As-Sunni (Hadith no. 69), Ibn Hibban (Hadith no. 2361).

pageTitle: Asking for healthy body, eyesight and hearing and refuge from disbelief and poverty

details.top: Seven times morning and evening
details.arabic: حَسْبِيَ اللَّهُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ عَلَيهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
details.transliteration: Hasbiyallaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwa 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa Huwa Rabbul-'Arshil-'Adheem.
details.translations: Allaah is Sufficient for me, none has the right to be worshipped except Him, upon Him I rely and He is Lord of the exalted throne.
details.bottom: Allah will grant whoever recites this Seven times in the morning or evening whatever he desires from this world or the next
details.Reference: Ibn As-Sunni (no. 71), Abu Dawud 4/321, Ibn As-Sunni. Quran 9:129

pageTitle: Grant whatever you desire from this life or the next

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالآخِرَةِ، اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي دِينِي وَدُنْيَايَ وَأَهْلِي، وَمَالِي، اللَّهُمَّ اسْتُرْ عَوْرَاتِي، وَآمِنْ رَوْعَاتِي، اللَّهُمَّ احْفَظْنِي مِنْ بَينِ يَدَيَّ، وَمِنْ خَلْفِي، وَعَنْ يَمِينِي، وَعَنْ شِمَالِي، وَمِنْ فَوْقِي، وَأَعُوذُ بِعَظَمَتِكَ أَنْ أُغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِي
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'afwa wal'aafiyata fid-dunyaa wal'aakhirati, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'afwa wal'aafiyata fee deenee wa dunyaaya wa 'ahlee, wa maalee, Allaahum-mastur 'awraatee, wa 'aamin raw'aatee, Allaahum-mahfadhnee min bayni yadayya, wa min khalfee, wa 'an yameenee, wa 'an shimaalee, wa min fawqee, wa 'a'oothu bi'adhamatika 'an 'ughtaala min tahtee.
details.translations: O Allaah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in this life and the next. O Allaah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in my religious and worldly affairs, and my family and my wealth. O Allaah, veil my weaknesses and set at ease my dismay. O Allaah, preserve me from the front and from behind and on my right and on my left and from above, and I take refuge with You lest I be swallowed up by the earth.
details.Reference: Sahih Ibn Majah 2/332, Abu Dawud.

pageTitle: Asking for pardon and wellbeing, veiling weakness and refuge from all sides

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ عَالِمَ الغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَاطِرَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ، رَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَمَلِيكَهُ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ الشَّيْطانِ وَ شِرْكِهِ ، وَأَنْ أَقْتَرِفَ عَلَى نَفْسِي سُوءًا، أَوْ أَجُرَّهُ إِلَى مُسْلِمٍ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Aalimal-ghaybi wash-shahaadati faatiras-samaawaati wal'ardhi, Rabba kulli shay'in wa maleekahu, 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, 'a'oothu bika min sharri nafsee, wa min sharrish-shaytaani wa shirkihi, wa 'an 'aqtarifa 'alaa nafsee soo'an, 'aw 'ajurrahu 'ilaa Muslimin.
details.translations: O Allaah, Knower of the unseen and the seen, Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things, I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil, and from committing wrong against my soul or bringing such upon another Muslim.
details.Reference: Sahih At-Tirmizi 3/142, Abu Dawud.

pageTitle: Refuge from the evil of oneself and shaitan and from harming oneself or others

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي لاَ يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلاَ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahil-lathee laa yadhurru ma'as-mihi shay'un fil-'ardhi wa laa fis-samaa'i wa Huwas-Samee 'ul- 'Aleem.
details.translations: In the name of Allaah with whose name nothing is harmed on earth nor in the heavens and He is The All-Seeing, The All-Knowing.
details.bottom: Whoever recites it in the morning will not be afflicted by any calamity before evening, and whoever recites it in the evening will not be overtaken by any calamity before morning
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/323, At-Tirmizi 5/465, Ibn Majah 2/332, Ahmad.

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: رَضِيتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبًّا، وَبِالْإِسْلاَمِ دِينًا وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ نَبِيًّا
details.transliteration: Radheetu billaahi Rabban, wa bil-'Islaami deenan, wa bi-Muhammadin (sallallaahu 'alayhi wa sallama) Nabiyyan.
details.translations: I am pleased with Allaah as a Lord, and Islaam as a religion and Muhammad as a Prophet.
details.bottom: Allah has promised that anyone who says every morning or evening will be pleased on the Day of Resurrection.
details.Reference: Ahmad 4/ 337, An-Nasa'i, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 68), At-Tirmizi 5/465.

pageTitle: Pleasure of Allah in the day of judgment

details.arabic: يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ أَسْتَغِيثُ أَصْلِحْ لِي شَأْنِيَ كُلَّهُ وَلاَ تَكِلْنِي إِلَى نَفْسِي طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ
details.transliteration: Yaa Hayyu yaa Qayyoomu birahmatika 'astagheethu 'aslih lee sha'nee kullahu wa laa takilnee 'ilaa nafsee tarfata 'aynin.
details.translations: O Ever Living, O Self-Subsisting and Supporter of all, by Your mercy I seek assistance, rectify for me all of my affairs and do not leave me to myself, even for the blink of an eye.
details.Reference: Al-Hakim 1/545. He said it is Sahih, and Dhahabi supported it. Also see, Sahih At-targhib wat tarhib 1/273

pageTitle: Ask for rectification of one's affairs

details.top: In the morning
details.arabic: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ، اللَّهُـمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ فَتْحَهُ، وَنَصْرَهُ، وَنُورَهُ، وَبَرَكَتَهُ، وَهُدَاهُ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيهِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ
details.transliteration: Asbahnaa wa 'asbahal-mulku (Amsaynaa wa 'amsal-mulku) lillaahi Rabbil-'aalameen, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayra haathal-yawmi (laylati), Fathahu wa nasrahu wa noorahu, wa barakatahu, wa hudaahu, wa'a'oothu bika min sharri maafeehi wa sharri maa ba'dahu.
details.translations: We have reached the morning and at this very time all sovereignty belongs to Allaah, Lord of the worlds. O Allaah, I ask You for the good of this day, its triumphs and its victories, its light and its blessings and its guidance, and I take refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil that follows it.

details.top: In the evening, say:
details.arabic: أَمْسَيْنَا وَ أَمْسَىا لْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ، اللَّهُـمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ :فَتْحَهَا، وَنَصْرَهَا، وَنُورَهَا، وَبَرَكَتَها، وَهُدَاهَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيها وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا
details.transliteration: Amsaynaa wa 'amsal-mulku lillaahi Rabbil-'aalameen, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayra haathihil-laylati, Fathaha wa nasraha wa nooraha, wa barakataha, wa hudaaha, wa'a'oothu bika min sharri maafeeha wa sharri maa ba'daha.
details.translations: We have reached the evening and at this very time all sovereignty belongs to Allaah, Lord of the worlds. O Allaah, I ask You for the good of this night, its triumphs and its victories, its light and its blessings and its guidance, and I take refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil that follows it.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/32.

details.top: In the morning (evening) say,
details.arabic: أَصْبَحْنَا (أَمْسَيْنَا) عَلَى فِطْرَةِ الْإِسْلاَمِ، وَعَلَى كَلِمَةِ الْإِخْلاَصِ، وَعَلَى دِينِ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ ، وَعَلَى مِلَّةِ أَبِينَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ، حَنِيفًا مُسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
details.transliteration: Asbahnaa (Amsaynaa) 'alaa fitratil-'Islaami wa 'alaa kalimatil-'ikhlaasi, wa 'alaa deeni Nabiyyinaa Muhammadin, wa 'alaa millati 'abeenaa 'Ibraaheema, haneefan Musliman wa maa kaana minal-mushrikeen.
details.translations: We rise in the morning (evening) upon the fitrah of Islaam, and the word of pure faith, and upon the religion of our Prophet Muhammad and the religion of our forefather Ibraaheem, who was a Muslim and of true faith and was not of those who associate others with Allaah.
details.Reference: Ahmad 3/406-7, 5/123, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmizi 4/209.

details.top: Whoever recites this:
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ
details.transliteration: Subhaanallaahi wa bihamdihi.
details.translations: How perfect Allaah is and I praise Him.
details.bottom: ...one hundred times in the morning and in the evening will not be surpassed on the Day of Resurrection by anyone having done better than this except for someone who had recited it more.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/2071.

pageTitle: Not surpassed by anyone except by one who says the dua more

details.top: Say ten times or once if lazy. [1]  OR  100 times:
details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
details.translations: None has the right to be worshipped except Allaah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise, and He is over all things omnipotent.
details.bottom: Whoever recites this hundred times in the morning, Allah swt will reward him of freeing ten slaves, Allah will write one hundred Hasanat and and forgive him one hundred misdeeds and be protected from Satan until evening. [2]
details.Reference:
[1] An-Nasa'i, Abu Dawud 4/319, Ibn Majah, Ahmad 4/60.
[2] Al-Bukhari 4/95, Muslim 4/2071.

pageTitle: Freeing Ten slaves, 100 Rewards, 100 Sins taken away

details.top:
The Mother of the Believers, Juwairiyah bint Al-Harith (RadhiAllahu 'anha) reported: The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) came out from my apartment in the morning as I was busy in performing the dawn prayer. He came back in the forenoon and found me sitting there.

The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) said, "Are you still in the same position as I left you.'' I replied in the affirmative. Thereupon the Prophet ﷺ said,

"I recited four words three times after I had left you. If these are to be weighed against all you have recited since morning, these will be heavier. "

Say:
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ عَدَدَ خَلْقِهِ، وَرِضَا نَفْسِهِ، وَزِنَةَ عَرْشِهِ، وَمِدَادَ كَلِمَاتِهِ
details.transliteration: Subhaanallaahi wa bihamdihi, 'Adada khalqihi, wa ridhaa nafsihi, wa zinata 'arshihi wa midaada kalimaatihi.
details.translations: How perfect Allaah is and I praise Him by the number of His creation and His pleasure, and by the weight of His throne, and the ink of His words.
details.bottom: ...three times in the morning.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/2090.

pageTitle: Four phrases Heavier in the Scales than all Morning of Worship

details.top: Recite in the morning
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka 'ilman naafi'an, wa rizqan tayyiban, wa 'amalan mutaqabbalan.
details.translations: O Allaah, I ask You for knowledge which is beneficial and sustenance which is good, and deeds which are acceptable.
details.Reference: Ibn As-Sunni (Hadith no. 54), Ibn Majah (Hadith no. 925).

pageTitle: Asking for Beneficial Knowledge, Pure Rizq & Accepted Deeds

details.top: One hundred times a day
details.arabic: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
details.transliteration: 'Astaghfirullaaha wa 'atoobu 'ilayhi.
details.translations: I seek Allaah's forgiveness and I turn to Him in repentance.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari,Fathul Bari 11/101, Muslim 4/2075.

details.top: Whoever recites this:
details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
details.transliteration: 'A'oothu bikalimaatil-laahit-taammaati min sharri maa khalaqa.
details.translations: I take refuge in Allaah's perfect words from the evil He has created.
details.bottom: …three times in the evening will be protected from insect stings.
details.Reference: Ahmad 2/ 290, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmizi 3/187, Ibn As-Sunni (Hadith no. 68), Ibn Majah 2/266.

details.top: Say ten times:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَسَلِّمْ عَلَى نَبَيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ
details.transliteration: Allahumma salli wa sallim 'alaa nabiyyinaa Muhammadin
details.translations: O Allaah, send prayers and peace upon our Prophet Muhammad.
details.bottom: The Prophet saw said: "Who recites blessings upon me 10 times in the morning and 10 times in the evening will obtain my intercession on the Day of Resurrection".
details.Reference: At-Tabrani, Sahih at-Targhib wa at-Tarhib 1/273.

pageTitle: Gain Prophet saw's intercession on the Day of Judgment

details.top:
When retiring to his bed every night, The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) would hold his palms together, and (whilst blowing - would) lightly spit in them, recite the last three chapters of the Quran and then wipe over his entire body as much as possible with his hands, beginning with his head and face and then all parts of the body.
He would do this three times.

Recite Al-Ikhlas, Al-Falaq and An-Nas
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ ﴿١﴾ اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ ﴿٢﴾ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ ﴿٣﴾ وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ ﴿٤﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul Huwallaahu 'Ahad. Allaahus-Samad. Lam yalid wa lam yoolad. Wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'ahad.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: He is Allah (the) One. The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He begets not nor was He begotten, and there is none equal to Him

details.top: 2.Soorah al-Falaq(113):
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَ‌بِّ الْفَلَقِ ﴿١﴾ مِن شَرِّ‌ مَا خَلَقَ ﴿٢﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ ﴿٣﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ ﴿٤﴾ وَمِن شَرِّ‌ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ ﴿٥﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul 'a'oo<u>th</u>u birabbil-falaq. Min sharri maa khalaq. Wa min sharri ghaasiqin 'i<u>th</u>aa waqab. Wa min sharrin-naffaathaati fil-'uqad. Wa min sharri haasidin 'i<u>th</u>aa hasad.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of the daybreak, from the evil of what He has created, and from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness, and from the evil of those who practice witchcraft when they blow in the knots, and from the evil of the envier when he envies.

details.top: 3. Soorah al-Naas:(114)
details.arabic:
﷽
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَ‌بِّ النَّاسِ ﴿١﴾ مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ﴿٢﴾ إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ ﴿٣﴾ مِن شَرِّ‌ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ ﴿٤﴾ الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ‌ النَّاسِ ﴿٥﴾ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ ﴿٦﴾
details.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. Qul 'a'oo<u>th</u>u birabbin-naas. Malikin-naas. 'Ilaahin-naas. Min sharril-waswaasil-khannaas. Alla<u>th</u>ee yuwaswisu fee sudoorin-naas. Minal-jinnati wannaas.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say: I seek refuge with (Allah) the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the whisperer who withdraws, who whispers in the breasts of mankind, of jinns and men.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari,Fathul Bari 9/62, Muslim 4/ 1723.

pageTitle: Last three Surahs of the Quran

details.top: Whoever reads Ayatul Kursi when he lies down to sleep will have a guardian from Allah remain with him and Satan will not be able to come near him until he rises in the morning.
details.arabic: اللَّهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَىُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ
details.transliteration: Allaahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwal-Hayyul-Qayyoom,
details.translations: Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists.

details.arabic: لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ
details.transliteration: laa ta'khu<u>th</u>uhu sinatun wa laa nawm,
details.translations: Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him.

details.arabic: لَّهُ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ۗ
details.transliteration: lahu maa fis-samaawaati wa maafil-'ardh,
details.translations: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.

details.arabic: مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ
details.transliteration: man <u>th</u>al-la<u>th</u>ee yashfa'u 'indahu 'illaa bi'<u>ith</u>nih,
details.translations: Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission?

details.arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ
details.transliteration: ya'lamu maa bayna 'aydeehim wa maa khalfahum,
details.translations: He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter.

details.arabic: وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ
details.transliteration: wa laa yuheetoona bishay'im-min 'ilmihi 'illaa bimaa shaa'a,
details.translations: And they will never compass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills.

details.arabic: وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ
details.transliteration: wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samaawaati wal'ardh,
details.translations: His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth,

details.arabic: وَلاَ يَؤُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ
details.transliteration: wa laa ya'ooduhu hif<u>dh</u>uhumaa,
details.translations: and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them.

details.arabic: وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيمُ
details.transliteration: wa Huwal-'Aliyyul- 'A<u>dh</u>eem.
details.translations: And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
details.bottom: Soorah al-Baqarah: Ayah(255)
details.Reference:
Al-Baqarah 2:255, Al-Bukhari, Fathul Bari 4/487, No 2311

An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (Hadith no. 100), also Ibn As-Sunni (no. 121). See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/339 and Silsilatul-Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/697 (no. 972).

details.top: Whoever recites the last two Aayahs of Soorah al-Baqarah at night, those two Aayahs shall be sufficient for him.
details.arabic: ءَامَنَ الرَّسُولُ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مِن رَّبِّهِۦ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۚ كُلٌّ ءَامَنَ بِاللَّهِ وَمَلٰٓئِكَتِهِۦ وَكُتُبِهِۦ وَرُسُلِهِۦ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِّن رُّسُلِهِۦ ۚ وَقَالُوا سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا ۖ غُفْرَانَكَ رَبَّنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ
details.transliteration: Aamanar-Rasoolu bimaa 'unzila ilayhi mir-Rabbihi walmu'minoon, kullun 'aamana billaahi wa malaa'ikatihi wa Kutubihi wa Rusulihi, laa nufarriqu bayna 'ahadim-mir-Rusulihi, wa qaaloo sami'naa wa 'ata'naa ghufraanaka Rabbanaa wa 'ilaykal-maseer.
details.translations: The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying] , "We make no distinction between any of His messengers." And they say, "We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination." [285]

details.arabic: لَا يُكَلِّفُ اللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۚ لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتْ وَعَلَيْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ ۗ رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَآ إِن نَّسِينَآ أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَآ إِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُ عَلَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦ ۖ وَاعْفُ عَنَّا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَآ ۚ أَنتَ مَوْلٰىنَا فَانصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكٰفِرِينَ
details.transliteration: Laa yukallifullaahu nafsan 'illaa wus'ahaa, lahaa maa kasabat wa 'alayhaa mak-tasabat, Rabbanaa laa tu'aakhithnaa 'in naseenaa 'aw 'akhta'naa, Rabbanaa wa laa tahmil 'alaynaa 'isran kamaa hamaltahu 'alal-latheena min qablinaa, Rabbanaa wa laa tuhammilnaa maa laa taaqata lanaa bihi, wa'fu 'annaa, waghfir lanaa warhamnaa, 'Anta Mawlaanaa fansurnaa 'alal-qawmil-kaafireen.
details.translations: Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. "Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people." [286]
details.bottom: Soorah al-Baqarah, Aayahs 285-286
details.Reference: Al-Baqarah 2:285-6, Al-Bukhari, Fathul Bari 9/94, Muslim 1/554.

details.top: If one of you rises from his bed and then returns to it he should dust it with the edge of his garment three times for he does not know what has occurred in his absence and when he lies down he should supplicate:
details.arabic: بِاسْمِكَ رَبِّي وَضَعْتُ جَنْبِي، وَبِكَ أَرْفَعُهُ، فَإِن أَمْسَكْتَ نَفْسِي فارْحَمْهَا، وَإِنْ أَرْسَلْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا، بِمَا تَحْفَظُ بِهِ عِبَادَكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
details.transliteration: Bismika Rabbee wadha'tu janbee , wa bika 'arfa'uhu, fa'in 'amsakta nafsee farhamhaa, wa 'in 'arsaltahaa fahfadhhaa, bimaa tahfadhu bihi 'ibaadakas-saaliheen.
details.translations: In Your name my Lord, I lie down and in Your name I rise, so if You should take my soul then have mercy upon it, and if You should return my soul then protect it in the manner You do so with Your righteous servants.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 11/126, Muslim 4/2084.

pageTitle: If risen from the bed and return to it afterwards

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّكَ خَلَقْتَ نَفْسِي وَأَنْتَ تَوَفَّاهَا، لَكَ مَمَاتُهَا وَمَحْيَاهَا، إِنْ أَحْيَيْتَهَا فَاحْفَظْهَا، وَإِنْ أَمَتَّهَا فَاغْفِرْ لَهَا، اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ العَافِيَةَ
details.transliteration: Allaahwmma 'innaka khalaqta nafsee wa 'Anta tawaffaahaa, laka mamaatuhaa wa mahyaahaa, 'in 'ahyaytahaa fahfadhhaa, wa 'in 'amattahaa faghfir lahaa . Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'aafiyata.
details.translations: O Allaah, verily You have created my soul and You shall take it's life, to You belong it's life and death. If You should keep my soul alive then protect it, and if You should take it's life then forgive it. O Allaah, I ask You to grant me good health.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/2083, Ahmad 2/79.

details.top: The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) would place his right hand under his cheek when about to sleep and supplicate:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ قِنِي عَذَابَكَ يَوْمَ تَبْعَثُ عِبَادَكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma qinee 'athaabaka yawma tab'athu 'ibaadaka.
details.translations: O Allaah, protect me from Your punishment on the day Your servants are resurrected.'
details.bottom: ...three times
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/311, Sahih At-Tirmizi 3/143.

details.arabic: بِاسْمِكَ اللَّهُمَّ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا
details.transliteration: Bismika Allaahumma 'amootu wa 'ahyaa.
details.translations: In Your name O Allaah, I live and die.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, Fathul Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/2083.

details.top: 'Shall I not direct you both to something better than a servant? When you go to bed say:'
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Subhaanallaahi
details.translations: How Perfect Allaah is.
details.bottom: ….thirty-three times

details.arabic: وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
details.transliteration: Walhamdu lillaahi
details.translations: All praise is for Allaah.
details.bottom: ...thirty-three times

details.arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
details.transliteration: Wallaahu 'akbar.
details.translations: Allaah is the greatest.
details.bottom: ...thirty-four times...for that is indeed better for you both than a servant.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, Fathul Bari 7/71, Muslim 4/2091.

pageTitle: Dua that is better than a servant

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَرَبَّ الأَرْضِ، وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ، رَبَّنَا وَرَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ، فَالِقَ الْحَبِّ وَالنَّوَى، وَمُنْزِلَ التَّوْرَاةِ وَالْإِنْجِيلِ، وَالْفُرْقَانِ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ أَنْتَ آخِذٌ بِنَاصِيَتِهِ،
details.transliteration: Allaahumma Rabbas-samaawaatis-sab'i wa Rabbal-'Arshil-'Adheem, Rabbanaa wa Rabba kulli shay 'in, faaliqal-habbi wannawaa , wa munzilat-Tawraati wal-'Injeeli, wal-Furqaani, 'a'oothu bika min sharri kulli shay 'in 'Anta 'aakhithun binaasiyatihi.
details.translations: O Allaah, Lord of the seven heavens and the exalted throne, our Lord and Lord of all things, Splitter of the seed and the date stone, Revealer of the Towraat, the Injeel and the Furqaan, I take refuge in You from the evil of all things You shall seize by the forelock.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ الأَوَّلُ فَلَيْسَ قَبْلَكَ شَيْءٌ، وَأَنْتَ الآخِرُ فَلَيسَ بَعْدَكَ شَيْءٌ، وَأَنْتَ الظَّاهِرُ فَلَيْسَ فَوْقَكَ شَيْءٌ، وَأَنْتَ الْبَاطِنُ فَلَيْسَ دُونَكَ شَيْءٌ، اقْضِ عَنَّا الدَّيْنَ وَأَغْنِنَا مِنَ الْفَقْرِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Antal-'Awwalu falaysa qablaka shay'un, wa 'Antal-'Aakhiru falaysa ba'daka shay'un, wa 'Antadh-Dhaahiru falaysa fawqaka shay'un, wa 'Antal-Baatinu falaysa doonaka shay'un, iqdhi 'annad-dayna wa 'aghninaa minal-faqri.
details.translations: O Allaah, You are The First so there is nothing before You and You are The Last so there is nothing after You. You are ath-Thaahir so there is nothing above You and You are al-Baatin so there is nothing closer than You. Settle our debt for us and spare us from poverty.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/2084.

details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا، وَكَفَانَا، وَآوَانَا، فَكَمْ مِمَّنْ لاَ كَافِيَ لَهُ وَلاَ مُؤْوِيَ
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-lathee 'at'amanaa wa saqaanaa, wa kafaanaa, wa 'aawaanaa, fakam mimman laa kaafiya lahu wa laa mu'wiya.
details.translations: All praise is for Allaah, Who fed us and gave us drink, and Who is sufficient for us and has sheltered us, for how many have none to suffice them or shelter them.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/2085.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ عَالِمَ الغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَاطِرَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ، رَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَمَلِيكَهُ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ الشَّيْطانِ وَشِرْكِهِ، وَأَنْ أَقْتَرِفَ عَلَى نَفْسِي سُوءًا، أَوْ أَجُرَّهُ إِلَى مُسْلِمٍ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Aalimal-ghaybi wash-shahaadati faatiras-samaawaati wal'ardhi, Rabba kulli shay 'in wa maleekahu, 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, 'a'oothu bika min sharri nafsee, wa min sharrish-shaytaani wa shirkihi, wa 'an 'aqtarifa 'alaa nafsee soo 'an, 'aw 'ajurrahu 'ilaa Muslimin.
details.translations: O Allaah, Knower of the seen and the unseen, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil, and from committing wrong against my soul or bringing such upon another Muslim.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/317, Sahih At-Tirmizi 3/142.

details.top: The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) never used to sleep until he had recited Soorah as-Sajdah(Sura 32) and Soorah al-Mulk(Sura 67).
details.Reference: At-Tirmizi, An-Nasa'i, Sahih al-Jami' as-Saghir 4/255.

details.top: If you take to your bed, then perform ablution, lie on your right side and then supplicate:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِي إِلَيْكَ، وَفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِي إِلَيْكَ، وَوَجَّهْتُ وَجْهِي إِلَيْكَ، وَأَلْجَأْتُ ظَهْرِي إِلَيْكَ، رَغْبَةً وَرَهْبَةً إِلَيْكَ، لاَ مَلْجَأَ وَلاَ مَنْجَا مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِلَيْكَ، آمَنْتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الَّذِي أَنْزَلْتَ، وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلْتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'aslamtu nafsee 'ilayka, wa fawwadhtu 'amree 'ilayka, wa wajjahtu wajhee 'ilayka, wa 'alja'tu dhahree 'ilayka, raghbatan wa rahbatan 'ilayka, laa maalja' wa laa manja minka 'illaa 'ilayka, 'aamantu bikitaabikal-lathee 'anzalta wa bi-nabiyyikal-lathee 'arsalta.
details.translations: O Allaah, I submit my soul unto You, and I entrust my affair unto You, and I turn my face towards You, and I totally rely on You, in hope and fear of You. Verily there is no refuge nor safe haven from You except with You. I believe in Your Book which You have revealed and in Your Prophet whom You have sent.
details.bottom: ...If you then die, you will die upon the fitrah.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, Fathul Bari 11/113, Muslim 4/2081.

details.top: 'Aaishah (radhi-yAllaahu 'Anhaa) narrated that the Messenger of Allaah (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) used to say at night if he turned during sleep:
details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهّارُ، رَبُّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahul-Waahidul-Qahhaaru, Rabbus-samaawaati wal'ardhi wa maa baynahumal-'Azeezul-Ghaffaaru.
details.translations: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, the One, the Victorious, Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the All-Forgiving.
details.Reference: Sahih by Hakim. Imam Dhahabi 1/540; Nasai, Amalul Yaomi Wallayla No. 202, Ibnus sunni No. 757. Also see, Sahih Jame 4:213

pageTitle: When turning over during the night

details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ غَضَبِهِ وَعِقَابِهِ، وَشَرِّ عِبَادِهِ، وَمِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّياطِينِ وَأَنْ يَحْضُرُونِ
details.transliteration: A'oo<u>th</u>u bikalimaatil-laahit-taammaati min ghadhabihi wa 'iqaabihi, wa sharri 'ibaadihi, wa min hamazaatish-shayaateeni wa 'an yahdhuroon.
details.translations: I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah from His anger and His punishment, from the evil of His slaves and from the taunts of devils and from their presence.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/12. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At- Tirmithi 3/171

pageTitle: Upon experiencing fear or unrest during sleep

details.top:
The righteous dream is from Allaah and the bad dream is from the devil, so if anyone sees something which pleases him then he should only relate it to one whom he loves...

Summary of what to do upon having a bad dream:

1. Spit to your left (three times).

2. Seek refuge in Allah from the Devil and from the evil of what you have seen (three times).

3. Do not speak about it to anyone.

4. Turn over on your other side.

5. Get up and pray if you desire to do so.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/1 772, 3.

pageTitle: Upon seeing a good or a bad dream

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اهْدِنِي فِيمَنْ هَدَيْتَ، وَعَافِنِي فِيمَنْ عَافَيْتَ، وَتَوَلَّنِي فِيمَنْ تَوَلَّيْتَ، وَبَارِكْ لِي فِيمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَقِنِي شَرَّ مَا قَضَيْتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-mahdinee feeman hadayta, wa 'aafinee feeman 'aafayta, wa tawallanee feeman tawallayta, wa baarik lee feemaa 'a'atayta, wa qinee sharra maa qadhayta,
details.translations: O Allah, guide me with those whom You have guided, and strengthen me with those whom You have given strength. Take me to Your care with those whom You have taken to Your care. Bless me in what You have given me. Protect me from the evil You have ordained

details.arabic: فَإِنَّكَ تَقْضِي وَلاَ يُقْضَى عَلَيْكَ، إِنَّهُ لاَ يَذِلُّ مَنْ وَالَيْتَ، (وَلاَ يَعِزُّ مَنْ عَادَيْتَ) تَبارَكْتَ رَبَّنا وَتَعَالَيْتَ
details.transliteration: fa'innaka taqdhee wa laa yuqdhaa 'alayka, 'innahu laa ya<u>th</u>illu man waalayta, [wa laa ya 'izzu man 'aadayta] , tabaarakta Rabbanaa wa ta'aalayta.
details.translations: Surely, You command and are not commanded, and none whom You have committed to Your care shall be humiliated [and none whom You have taken as an enemy shall taste glory] . You are Blessed, Our Lord, and Exalted.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, Ahmad, Ad-Darimi, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/144, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-GhaW. 2/ 172.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِرِضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ، وَبِمُعَافَاتِكَ مِنْ عُقُوبَتِكَ، وَأَعُــوذُ بِكَ مِنْكَ، لاَ أُحْصِي ثَنَاءً عَلَيْكَ، أَنْتَ كَمَا أَثْنَيْتَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u biridhaaka rain sakhatika, wa bimu'aafaatika min 'uqoobatika, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minka, laa 'uhsee thanaa'an 'alayka, 'Anta kamaa 'athnayta 'alaa nafsika.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek refuge with Your Pleasure from Your anger. I seek refuge in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek refuge in You from You. I cannot count Your praises, You are as You have praised Yourself.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, Ahmad. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/180, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil. 2/ 175.

details.arabic: اَللَّهُمَّ إِيَّاكَ نعْبُدُ، وَلَكَ نُصَلِّي وَنَسْجُدُ، وَإِلَيْكَ نَسْعَى وَنَحْفِدُ، نَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ، وَنَخْشَى عَذَابَكَ، إِنَّ عَذَابَكَ بِالكَافِرِينَ مُلْحَقٌ، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْتَعِينُكَ، وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ، وَنُثْنِي عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ، وَلاَ نَكْفُرُكَ، وَنُؤْمِنُ بِكَ، وَنَخْضَعُ لَكَ، وَنَخْلَعُ مَنْ يَكْفرُكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'iyyaaka na'budu, wa laka nusallee wa nasjudu, wa 'ilayka nas'aa wa nahfidu, narjoo rahmataka, wa nakhshaa 'a<u>th</u>aabaka, 'inna 'a<u>th</u>aabaka bilkaafireena mulhaq. Allaahumma 'innaa nasta'eenuka, wa nastaghfiruka, wa nuthnee 'alaykal-khayr, wa laa nakfuruka, wa nu'minu bika, wa nakhdha'u laka, wa nakhla'u man yakfuruka.
details.translations: O Allah, You alone do we worship and to You we pray and bow down prostrate. To You we hasten to worship and to serve. Our hope is for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. Surely, Your punishment of the disbelievers is at hand. O Allah, we seek Your help and Your forgiveness, and we praise You beneficently. We do not deny You and we believe in You. We surrender to You and renounce whoever disbelieves in You.
details.Reference: Al-Bayhaqi graded its chain authentic in As-Sunan Al-Kubra. Al-Albani said in 'Irwa'ul-GhaliL 2/170 that its chain is authentic as a statement of 'Umar.

details.top: After giving salaam from the Witr Prayer, Prophet saw would supplicate:
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ المَلِكِ القُدُّوسِ
details.transliteration: Subhaanal-Malikil-Quddoosi.
details.translations: Glory is to the King, the Holy. [1]
details.bottom: ...three times,

details.top: and then raise and extend the voice on the third time and say:
details.arabic: رَبِّ الْمَلاَئِكَةِ وَالرُّوحِ
details.transliteration: Rabbil-malaa'ikati warroohi.
details.translations: Lord of the angels and the Spirit. [2]
details.Reference:
[1] An-Nasa'i 3/244, Ad-Daraqutni and others. The final addition is from Ad-Daraqutni's version 2/ 31 and its chain of narration is authentic. See the checking of Zadul-Ma'ad by Shu'aib Al-Arna'ut and 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut 1/337.
[2] Abu Dawud 2/87. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mdjah 2/335

pageTitle: After salaam of the Witr prayer

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي عَبْدُكَ، ابْنُ عَبْدِكَ، ابْنُ أَمَتِكَ، نَاصِيَتِي بِيَدِكَ، مَاضٍ فِيَّ حُكْمُكَ، عَدْلٌ فِيَّ قَضَاؤُكَ، أَسْأَلُكَ بِكُــــلِّ اسْمٍ هُوَ لَكَ، سَمَّيْتَ بِهِ نَفْسَكَ، أَوْ أَنْزَلْتَهُ فِي كِتَابِكَ، أَوْ عَلَّمْتَهُ أَحَداً مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، أَوِ اسْتَأْثَرْتَ بِهِ فِي عِلْمِ الغَيْبِ عِنْدَكَ، أَنْ تَجْعَلَ القُرْآنَ رَبِيعَ قَلْبِي، وَنُورَ صَدْرِي، وَجَلاَءَ حُزْنِي، وَذَهَابَ هَمِّي
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'abduka, ibnu 'abdika, ibnu 'amatika, naasiyatee biyadika, maadhin fiyya hukmuka, 'adlun fiyya qadhaa'uka, 'as'aluka bikulli ismin huwa laka, sammayta bihi nafsaka, 'aw 'anzaltahu fee kitaabika, 'aw 'allamtahu 'ahadan min khalqika, 'awista'tharta bihi fee 'ilmil-ghaybi 'indaka, 'an taj'alal-Qur'aana rabee'a qalbee, wa noora sadree, wa jalaa'a huznee, wa <u>th</u>ahaaba hammee.
details.translations: O Allah, I am Your slave and the son of Your male slave and the son of your female slave. My forehead is in Your Hand (i.e. you have control over me). Your Judgment upon me is assured and Your Decree concerning me is just. I ask You by every Name that You have named Yourself with, revealed in Your Book, taught any one of Your creation or kept unto Yourself in the knowledge of the unseen that is with You, to make the Qur'an the spring of my heart, and the light of my chest, the banisher of my sadness and the reliever of my distress.
details.Reference: Ahmad 1/391, and Al-Albani graded it authentic.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ، وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ، وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika minal-hammi walhazani, wal'ajzi walkasali, walbukhli waljubni, wa dhala'id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rijaal.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek refuge in you from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and overpowered by men (i.e. others).
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/158. See also Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/173

details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ الْعَظِيمُ الْحَلِيمُ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ رَبُّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَرَبُّ الْأَرْضِ وَرَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيمِ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahul-'A<u>dh</u>eemul-Haleem, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu Rabbul-'Arshil-'A<u>dh</u>eem, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu Rabbus-samaawaati wa Rabbul-'ardhi wa Rabbul-'Arshil-Kareem.
details.translations: There is none worthy of worship but Allah the Mighty, the Forbearing. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, and Lord of the Noble Throne.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 8/154, Muslim 4/2092

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَحْمَتَكَ أَرْجُو، فَلاَ تَكِلْنِي إِلَى نَفْسِي طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ، وَأَصْلِحْ لِي شَأْنِي كُلَّهُ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma rahmataka 'arjoo falaa takilnee 'ilaa nafsee tarfata 'aynin, wa 'aslih lee sha'nee kullahu, laa'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta.
details.translations: O Allah, I hope for Your mercy. Do not leave me to myself even for the blinking of an eye (i.e. a moment). Correct all of my affairs for me. There is none worthy of worship but You.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42. Al-Albani graded it as good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/959

details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنْتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta subhaanaka 'innee kuntu mina<u>dh</u>-<u>dh</u>aalimeen.
details.translations: There is none worthy of worship but You, glory is to You. Surely, I was among the wrongdoers.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 5/529. Al-Hakim declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/ 505. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/168.

details.arabic: اللَّهُ، اللَّهُ رَبِّي لاَ أُشْرِكُ بِهِ شَيْئاً
details.transliteration: Allaahu Allaahu Rabbee laa 'ushriku bihishay'an.
details.translations: Allah, Allah is my Lord. I do not associate anything with Him.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/87 No. 1525,Ibn Maah No. 3882, Also see Sahih Ibn Majah 2/335

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَجْعَلُكَ فِي نُحُورِهِم، وَنَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شُرُورِهِمْ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innaa naj'aluka fee nuhoorihim wa na'oo<u>th</u>u bika min shuroorihim.
details.translations: O Allah, we ask You to restrain them by their necks and we seek refuge in You from their evil.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/89, and Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 2/142

pageTitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #1

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ عَضُدِي، وَأَنْتَ نَصِيرِي، بِكَ أَحُولُ وَبِكَ أَصُولُ، وَبِكَ أُقَاتِلُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Anta 'adhudee, wa 'Anta naseeree, bika 'ajoolu, wa bika 'asoolu, wa bika 'uqaatilu.
details.translations: O Allah, You are my strength and You are my support. For Your sake I go forth and for Your sake I advance and for Your sake I fight.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 3/42, At-Tirmithi 5/572. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/183.

pageTitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #2

details.arabic: حَسْبُنَا اللَّهُ وَنِعْمَ الْوَكِيلُ
details.transliteration: Hasbunallaahu wa ni'amal-wakeel.
details.translations: Allah is sufficient for us and the best of those on whom to depend.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, 5/172

pageTitle: Upon encountering an enemy or those of authority #3

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَوَاتِ السَّبْعِ، وَرَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ، كُنْ لِي جَاراً مِنْ فُلاَنِ بْنِ فُلاَنٍ، وَأَحْزَابِهِ مِنْ خَلاَئِقِكَ، أَنْ يَفْرُطَ عَلَيَّ أَحَدٌ مِنْهُمْ أَوْ يَطْغَى، عَزَّ جَارُكَ، وَجَلَّ ثَنَاؤُكَ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma Rabbas-samaawaatis-sab'i, wa Rabbal-'Arshil-'Adheem, kun lee jaaran min (name of the person), wa 'ahzaabihi min khalaa'iqika, 'an yafruta 'alayya 'ahadun minhum 'aw yatghaa, 'azzajaaruka, wajalla thanaa'uka, wa laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta.
details.translations: O Allah, Lord of the Seven heavens, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, be for me a support against (say the person's name) and his helpers from among your creatures, lest any of them abuse me or do me wrong. Mighty is Your patronage and glorious are Your praises. There is none worthy of worship but You.
details.Reference: Bukhari, Al Adab Al Mufrad No. 712 . Al-Albani graded it as sahih in Sahih Adab Al Mufrad No. 585

pageTitle: Dua against the oppression of rulers #1

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُ أَعَزُّ مِنْ خَلْقِهِ جَمِيعاً، اللَّهُ أَعَزُّ مِمَّا أَخَافُ وَأَحْذَرُ، أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ، الْمُمْسِكِ السَّمَوَاتِ السَّبْعِ أَنْ يَقَعْنَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِهِ، مِنْ شَرِّ عَبْدِكَ فُلاَنٍ، وَجُنُودِهِ وَأَتْبَاعِهِ وَأَشْيَاعِهِ، مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالإِنْسِ، اللَّهُمَّ كُنْ لِي جَاراً مِنْ شَرِّهِمْ، جَلَّ ثَنَاؤُكَ وَعَزَّ جَارُكَ، وَتَبَارَكَ اسْمُكَ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ غَيْرُكَ
details.transliteration: Allahu 'Akbar, Allahu 'a'azzu min khalqihi jamee'an, Allaahu 'a'azzu mimmaa 'akhaafu wa 'ahtharu, 'a'oothu billaahil-lathee laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwa, almumsikis-samaawaatis-sab'i 'an yaqa'na 'alal-'ardhi 'illaa. bi'ithnihi, min sham 'abdika (name of the person), wa junoodihi wa 'atbaa'ihi wa 'ashyaa'ihi, minal-jinni wal'insi, Allaahumma kun lee jaaran min sharrihim, jalla thanaa'uka wa 'azza jaaruka, wa tabaarakasmuka, wa laa 'ilaaha ghayruka.
details.translations: Allah is the Most Great, Mightier than all His creation. He is Mightier than what I fear and dread. I seek refuge in Allah, Who there is none worthy of worship but Him. He is the One Who holds the Seven heavens from falling upon the earth except by His command. (I seek refuge in You Allah) from the evil of Your slave (say the person's name), and his helpers, his followers and his supporters from among the jinn and mankind. O Allah, be my support against their evil. Glorious are Your praises and mighty is Your patronage. Blessed is Your Name, there is no true God but You.
details.Reference: Bukhari, Al Adab Al Mufrad No. 708 . Al-Albani graded it as sahih in Sahih Adab Al Mufrad No. 586

pageTitle: Dua against the oppression of rulers #2

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ مُنْزِلَ الْكِتَابِ، سَرِيعَ الْحِسَابِ، اهْزِمِ الأَحْزَابَ، اللَّهُمَّ اهزِمْهُمْ وَزَلْزِلْهُمْ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma munzilal-kitaabi, saree'al-hisaabi, ihzimil-'ahzaaba, Allaahumma ihzimhum wa zalzilhum.
details.translations: Allah, Revealer of the Book, Swift to account, defeat the groups (of disbelievers). O Allah, defeat them and shake them.
details.Reference: Muslim 3/1362.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اكْفِنِيهِمْ بِمَا شِئْتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahummak-fineehim bimaa shi'ta.
details.translations: O Allah, suffice (i.e. protect) me against them however You wish.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/2300.

pageTitle: What to say when in fear of people

details.top: He should seek refuge in Allaah.
details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
details.transliteration: 'A'oo<u>th</u>u billaahi minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
details.translations: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.

details.top:
He should renounce that which is causing such doubt [1] 

He should say:
details.arabic: آمَنْتُ بِاللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ
details.transliteration: 'Aamantu billaahi wa Rusulihi.
details.translations: I believe in Allah and His Messenger. [2]
details.Reference:
[1] Al Bukhaaree with al-Fath 6/336 and Muslim 1/120
[2] Muslim 1/119,120.

pageTitle: If afflicted with doubt in his faith #1

details.arabic: هُوَ الْأوَّلُ وَالْآخِرُ وَالظّاهِرُ وَالْبَاطِنُ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
details.transliteration: Huwal-'Awwalu wal-'Aakhiru wadh-Dhaahiru wal-Baatinu, wa Huwa bikulli shay'in 'Aleem.
details.translations: He is the First and the Last, the Most High and the Most Near. And He is the Knower of all things.
details.Reference: Al Hadid 57:3; Abu Dawud 4/329. Declared hasan by Al-Albaanee and al-Arna'uut

pageTitle: If afflicted with doubt in his faith #2

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اكْفِنِي بِحَلاَلِكَ عَنْ حَرَامِكَ، وَأَغْنِنِي بِفَضْلِكَ عَمَّنْ سِوَاكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahummak-finee bihalaalika 'an haraamika wa 'aghninee bifadhlika 'amman siwaaka.
details.translations: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden, and make me independent of all others besides You.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 5/560. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/180

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ، وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ، وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oothu bika minal-hammi walhazani, wal'ajzi walkasali, walbukhli waljubni, wa dhala'id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rijaali.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and from being overpowered by men (i.e. other people).
details.Reference: Al-Bukhaaree 7/157

details.top:
Uthmaan Ibn al-'Aas (radhi-yAllaahu 'anhu) narrated:
I said 'O Messenger of Allaah, verily the devil comes between me and my prayer and recitation making me confused'

The Messenger of Allaah (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) replied:
''That is a devil called Khanzab, so if you sense his presence then seek refuge in Allaah from him and spit on your left side three times.''
details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
details.transliteration: 'A'oo<u>th</u>u billaahi minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
details.translations: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.
details.Reference: Muslim 4/1729

pageTitle: If afflicted by whisperings in prayer or recitation

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لاَ سَهْلَ إِلاَّ مَا جَعَلْتَهُ سَهْلاً، وَأَنْتَ تَجْعَلُ الْحَزْنَ إِذَا شِئْتَ سَهْلاً
details.transliteration: Allaahumma laa sahla illaa maa ja'altahu sahlan wa Anta taj'alul-hazna 'i<u>th</u>aa shi'ta sahlan.
details.translations: O Allah, there is no ease other than what You make easy. If You please You ease sorrow.
details.Reference: Ibn Hibban in his Sahih (no. 2427), and Ibn As- Sunni (no. 351). Al-Hafidh (Ibn Hajar) said that this Hadith is authentic. It was also declared authentic by 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-Athkarp. p106

pageTitle: When one's affairs have become difficult

details.top: Any servant who commits a sin and as a result, performs ablution, prays two units of prayer [i.e., two rakats] and then seeks Allaah's forgiveness, Allaah would forgive him.'
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/86, At-Tirmithi 2/257. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/283.

details.top:
Seeking refuge from him. [1] 

The Adhaan [call to prayer] . [2] 

Recitation of the Quran and the [authentic] words of remembrance and supplications. [3] 

Seeking refuge with Allah against Satan the Outcast:
details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجيمِ
details.transliteration: 'A'oo<u>th</u>u billaahi minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
details.translations: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.
details.bottom:
The Devil is also driven out by the invocations for morning and evening, those that are said before sleeping and upon waking up, those for entering and leaving the house, including those for entering and leaving the mosque, and by many other authentic invocations taught to us by the Prophet (SAW) such as the reading of 'Ayatul-Kursi, (Al-Baqarah 2:255), and the last two 'Ayat of Surat Al-Baqarah before going to sleep.

Whoever says: 'There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and he is Able to do all things,' one hundred times, it will be a protection for him from the Devil throughout the day.'
details.Reference:
[1] Abu Dawud 1/206, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/77, and Surat Al-Mu'minun, 23:98-9.
[2] Muslim 1/291, Al-Bukhari 1/151.
[3] 'Do not turn your homes into graveyards, surely the Devil flees from the house in which Surat Al-Baqarah is read,' Muslim 1/539.

pageTitle: For expelling the devil and his whisperings

details.top: The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allaah, than the weak believer and there is goodness in both. Strive for that which will benefit you, seek help from Allaah and do not despair. If a mishap should happen to befall you then do not say: If only I had acted...such and such would have happened'. Rather, say:
details.arabic: قَدَرُ اللَّه وَمَا شَاءَ فَعَلَ
details.transliteration: Qadarullaahi wa maa shaa'afa'ala.
details.translations: It is the Decree of Allah and He does whatever He wills. [1]

details.top:
...for verily 'If' lets in the work of the devil.

Indeed Allaah (Subhaanahu wa Ta'aala) rebukes due to negligence and slackness, but take to determination and caution, and if a matter should overtake you then say:
details.arabic: حَسْبُنَا اللَّهُ وَنِعْمَ الوَكِيلُ
details.transliteration: Hasbunallaahu wa ni'amal-wakeel.
details.translations: Allaah is sufficient for me, and how fine a trustee (He is). [2]
details.Reference:
[1] Muslim 4/2052
[2] Abu Daawud and see: checking of Zaad Al-Ma'aad, Pg. 106

pageTitle: When stricken with a mishap or overtaken by an affair

details.top: To the new parent:
details.arabic: بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوبِ لَكَ، وَشَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ، وَبَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ، وَرُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ
details.transliteration: Baarakallaahu laka fil-mawhoobi laka, wa shakartal-waahiba, wa balagha 'ashuddahu, wa ruziqta birrahu.
details.translations: May Allah bless you with His gift to you, and may you (the new parent) give thanks, may the child reach the maturity of years, and may you be granted its righteousness. [1]

details.top: Reply of the parents would be:
details.arabic: بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَزَاكَ اللَّهُ خَيْراً، وَرَزَقَكَ اللَّهُ مِثْلَهُ، وَأَجْزَلَ ثَوَابَكَ
details.transliteration: Baarakallahu laka wa baaraka 'alayka, wa jazaakallaahu khayran, wa razaqakallaahu mithlahu, wa 'ajzala thawaabaka.
details.translations: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and may Allah reward you well and bestow upon you its like and reward you abundantly". [2]
details.Reference:
[1] This is menioned as a saying of Hasan Al basri Rahimullah. See tuhfatul maodud fi Ibn Qaiiyum, Page. 20, he connected this with Ibn Munzir's Al-Awsat
[2] An-Nawawi Al-Azkar Page. 349. Also see Sahih Azkar fil Nawawi, Salim al Hilali 2/713. For more details, read Az Zikr wa dua Wal Ilaj bir Ruqwa Page. 1/416

pageTitle: Congratulations on the occasion of a birth

details.top: The Messenger of Allaah (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) used to commend al-Hasan and al-Husayn to Allaah's protection, saying:
details.arabic: أُعِيذُكُمَا بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّةِ مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ وَهَامَّةٍ، وَمِنْ كُلِّ عَيْنٍ لاَمَّةٍ
details.transliteration: U'ee<u>th</u>ukumaa bikalimaatil-laahit-taammati min kulli shaytaanin wa haammatin, wa min kulli 'aynin laammatin.
details.translations: I seek protection for you in the Perfect Words of Allah from every devil and every beast, and from every envious blameworthy eye.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 4/119.

details.top:
Alee ibn Abee Taalib (radhi-yAllaahu 'anhu) related that he heard the Messenger of Allaah (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) say:

If a man calls on his sick Muslim brother, it is as if he walks reaping the fruits of Paradise until he sits, and when he sits he is showered in mercy, and if this was in the morning, seventy thousand angels send prayers upon him until the evening, and if this was in the evening, seventy thousand angels send prayers upon him until the morning.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi, Ibn Majah, Ahmad. See, Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/244, and Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/286. It was also graded authentic by Ahmad Shakir.

details.top: When The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) would enter upon a sick person, he would say:
details.arabic: لاَ بأْسَ طَهُورٌ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ
details.transliteration: Laa ba'sa tahoorun 'inshaa'Allaah.
details.translations: Do not worry, it will be a purification (for you), Allah willing.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani Fathul-Bari 10/118

details.top: Any Muslim servant who visits a sick person whose prescribed moment of death has not arrived and supplicates seven times:
details.arabic: أَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ الْعَظِيمَ رَبَّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ أَنْ يَشْفِيَكَ
details.transliteration: As'alullaahal-'A<u>dh</u>eema Rabbal-'Arshil-'A<u>dh</u>eemi 'an yashfiyaka.
details.translations: I ask Almighty Allah, Lord of the Magnificent Throne, to make you well.
details.bottom: …then perhaps, for this reason, Allah will cure the person (if not near Death)
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi, Abu Dawud. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/210 and Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/180.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالرَّفِيقِ الْأَعْلَى
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maghfir lee warhamnee wa 'alhiqnee bir-rafeeqil-'a'laa.
details.translations: O Allah, forgive me and have mercy upon me and join me with the highest companions (in Paradise).
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari7/10, Muslim 4/1893

pageTitle: When the sick have renounced all hope of life #1

details.top: 'Aaishah (radhi-yAllaahu 'anhaa) related that The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) [during his illness in which he passed away] would dip his hands in water and then he would wipe his face and say:
details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ إِنَّ لِلْمَوْتِ سَكَرَاتٍ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu 'inna lilmawti lasakaraatin.
details.translations: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, surely death has agonies.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/144. The Hadith also mention him using the Siwak (tooth stick).

pageTitle: When the sick have renounced all hope of life #2

details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ لَهُ المُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wallaahu 'Akbar, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu wa laa hawla wa laa quwwata 'illaa billaah.
details.translations: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Allah is the Most Great. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, His is the dominion and His is the praise. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, there is no power and no might but by Allah.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/317.

pageTitle: When the sick have renounced all hope of life #3

details.top: He whose last words are:
details.arabic: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahu.
details.translations: There is none worthy of worship but Allah.
details.bottom: ...will enter Paradise.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 3/190. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/432.

pageTitle: Instruction for the one nearing death

details.arabic: إِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنَّا إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُونَ، اللَّهُمَّ أْجُرْنِي فِي مُصِيبَتِي، وَأَخْلِفْ لِي خَيْرًا مِنْهَا
details.transliteration: Innaa lillaahi wa 'innaa 'ilayhi raaji'oon, Allaahumma'-jurni fee museebatee wa 'akhliflee khayran minhaa.
details.translations: We are from Allah and unto Him we return. O Allah take me out of my plight and bring to me after it something better.
details.Reference: Muslim 2/632.

pageTitle: Dua for one afflicted by a calamity

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِفُلاَنٍ (بِاسْمِهِ) وَارْفَعْ دَرَجَتَهُ فِي الْمَهْدِيِّينَ، وَاخْلُفْهُ فِي عَقِبِهِ فِي الْغَابِرِينَ، وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلَهُ يَا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ، وَافْسَحْ لَهُ فِي قَبْرِهِ، وَنَوِّرْ لَهُ فِيهِ
details.transliteration: Allaahummaghfir li (name of the person) warfa' darajatahu fil-mahdiyyeena, wakhlufhu fee 'aqibihi fil-ghaabireena, waghfir-lanaa wa lahu yaa Rabbal-'aalameena, wafsah lahu fee qabrihi wa nawwir lahu feehi
details.translations: O Allah, forgive [name of the person] and elevate his station among those who are guided. Send him along the path of those who came before, and forgive us and him, O Lord of the worlds. Enlarge for him his grave and shed light upon him in it.
details.Reference: Muslim 2/634

pageTitle: When closing the eyes of the deceased

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْهُ، وَعَافِهِ، وَاعْفُ عَنْهُ، وَأَكْرِمْ نُزُلَهُ، وَوَسِّعْ مُدْخَلَهُ، وَاغْسِلْهُ بِالْمَاءِ وَالثَّلْجِ وَالْبَرَدِ، وَنَقِّهِ مِنَ الْخَطَايَا كَمَا نَقَّيْتَ الثَّوْبَ الأَبْيَضَ مِنَ الدَّنَسِ، وَأَبْدِلْهُ دَاراً خَيْراً مِنْ دَارِهِ، وَأَهْلاً خَيْراً مِنْ أَهْلِهِ، وَزَوْجَاً خَيْراً مِنْ زَوْجِهِ، وَأَدْخِلْهُ الْجَنَّةَ، وَأَعِذْهُ مِنْ عَذَابِ القَبْرِ [وَعَذَابِ النَّارِ]
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maghfir lahu warhamhu, wa 'aafihi, wa'fu 'anhu, wa 'akrim nuzulahu, wa wassi' mudkhalahu, waghsilhu bilmaa'i waththalji walbaradi, wa naqqihi minal-khataayaa kamaa naqqaytath-thawbal-'abyadha minad-danasi, wa 'abdilhu daaran khayran min daarihi, wa 'ahlan khayran min 'ahlihi, wa zawjan khayran min zawjihi, wa 'adkhilhul-jannata, wa. 'a'<u>ith</u>hu min 'a<u>th</u>aabil-qabri [wa 'a<u>th</u>aabin-naar] .
details.translations: O Allah, forgive him and have mercy on him and give him strength and pardon him. Be generous to him and cause his entrance to be wide and wash him with water and snow and hail. Cleanse him of his transgressions as white cloth is cleansed of stains. Give him an abode better than his home, and a family better than his family and a wife better than his wife. Take him into Paradise and protect him from the punishment of the grave [and from the punishment of Hell-fire] .
details.Reference: Muslim 2/663.

pageTitle: Dua for the deceased at the funeral prayer #1

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِحَيِّنَا وَمَيِّتِنَا، وَشَاهِدِنَا وَغَائِبِنَا، وَصَغِيرِنَا وَكَبِيرِنَا، وَذَكَرِنَا وَأُنْثَانَا، اللَّهُمَّ مَنْ أَحْيَيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَأَحْيِهِ عَلَى الْإِسْلاَمِ، وَمَنْ تَوَفَّيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَتَوَفَّهُ عَلَى الإِيمَانِ، اللَّهُمَّ لاَ تَحْرِمْنَا أَجْرَهُ، وَلاَ تُضِلَّنَا بَعْدَهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maghfir lihayyinaa, wa mayyitinaa, wa shaahidinaa, wa ghaa'ibinaa, wa sagheerinaa wa kabeerinaa, wa <u>th</u>akarinaa wa 'unthaanaa. Allaahumma man 'ahyaytahu minnaa fa'ahyihi 'alal-'Islaami, wa man tawaffaytahu minnaa fatawaffahu 'alal-'eemaani, Allaahumma laa tahrimnaa 'ajrahu wa laa tudhillanaa ba'dahu.
details.translations: O Allah forgive our living and our dead, those who are with us and those who are absent, our young and our old, our menfolk and our womenfolk. O Allah, whomever you give life from among us give him life in Islam, and whomever you take way from us take him away in Faith. O Allah, do not forbid us their reward and do not send us astray after them.
details.Reference: Ibn Majah 1/480, Ahmad 2/368. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251

pageTitle: Dua for the deceased at the funeral prayer #2

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّ فُلاَنَ بْنَ فُلاَنٍ فِي ذِمَّتِكَ، وَحَبْلِ جِوَارِكَ، فَقِهِ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْقَبْرِ، وَعَذَابِ النَّارِ، وَأَنْتَ أَهْلُ الْوَفَاءِ وَالْحَقِّ، فَاغْفِرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْهُ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'inna [name the person] fee <u>th</u>immatika, wa habli jiwaarika, faqihi min fitnatil-qabri wa 'a<u>th</u>aabin-naari, wa 'Anta 'ahlul-wafaa'i walhaqqi. Faghfir lahu warhaw.hu 'innaka 'Antal-Ghafoorur-Raheem.
details.translations: O Allah, surely [name the person] is under Your protection, and in the rope of Your security, so save him from the trial of the grave and from the punishment of the Fire. You fulfill promises and grant rights, so forgive him and have mercy on him. Surely You are Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
details.Reference: Ibn Majah, Abu Dawud 3/211. See also Al Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251

pageTitle: Dua for the deceased at the funeral prayer #3

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ عَبْدُكَ وَابْنُ أَمَتِكَ احْتَاجَ إِلَى رَحْمَتِكَ، وَأَنْتَ غَنِيٌّ عَنْ عَذَابِهِ، إِنْ كَانَ مُحْسِناً فَزِدْ فِي حَسَنَاتِهِ، وَإِنْ كَانَ مُسِيئاً فَتَجَاوَزْ عَنْهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'abduka wabnu 'amatika ihtaaja 'ilaa rahmatika, wa 'Anta ghaniyyun 'an 'a<u>th</u>aabihi, 'in kaana muhsinan fazid fee hasanaatihi, wa 'in kaana musee'an fatajaawaz 'anhu.
details.translations: O Allah, Your male slave and the child of Your female slave is in need of Your mercy, and You are not in need of his torment. If he was pious then increase his rewards and if he was a transgressor then pardon him..
details.Reference: Al-Hakim 1/359 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him. See also Al-Albani, Ahkamul-Jana'iz, p. 125

pageTitle: Dua for the deceased at the funeral prayer #4

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَعِذْهُ مِنْ عَذَابِ القَبْرِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'a'ith-hu min 'athaabil-qabri
details.translations: O Allah, protect him from the torment of the grave.
details.Reference: Malik al Muatta 1/288 ; Ibn Abi Saibah 3/217; Baihaqi 4/9;

pageTitle: Dua for a deceased child at the funeral prayer #1

details.top: One can also say:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ فَرَطاً وَذُخْراً لِوَالِدَيْهِ، وَشَفِيعاً مُجَاباً، اللَّهُمَّ ثَقِّلْ بِهِ مَوَازِينَهُمَا، وَأَعْظِمْ بِهِ أُجُورَهُمَا، وَأَلْحِقْهُ بِصَالِحِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، وَاجْعَلْهُ فِي كَفَالَةِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، وَقِهِ بِرَحْمَتِكَ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ، وَأَبْدِلْهُ دَاراً خَيْراً مِنْ دَارِهِ، وَأَهْلاً خَيْراً مِنْ أَهْلِهِ، اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِأَسْلاَفِنَا، وَأَفْرَاطِنَا، وَمَنْ سَبَقَنَا بِالْإِيمَانِ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maj'alhufaratan wa <u>th</u>ukhran liwaalidayhi, wa shafee'an mujaaban. Allaahumma thaqqil bihi mawaazeenahumaa wa 'a'<u>dh</u>im bihi 'ujoorahumaa, wa 'alhiqhu bisaalihil-mu'mineena, waj'alhu fee kafaalati 'Ibraaheema, wa qihi birahmatika 'a<u>th</u>aabal-jaheemi, wa 'abdilhu daaran khayran min daarihi, wa 'ahlan khayran min 'ahlihi, Allaahum-maghfir li'aslaafinaa, wa 'afraatinaa wa man sabaqanaa bil'eemaan.
details.translations: O Allah, make him a precursor, a forerunner and a treasure for his parents and an answered intercessor. O Allah, make him weigh heavily in their scales (of good) and magnify their reward. Make him join the righteous of the believers. Place him in the care of Ibrahim. Save him by Your mercy from the torment of Hell. Give him a home better than his home and a family better than his family. O Allah, forgive those who have gone (i.e. passed away) before us, our children lost (by death), and those who have preceded us in Faith.
details.Reference: Ibn Qudamah, Al-Mughni 3/416 and Ad-Duroosul-Muhimmah li-Aammatil-'Ummah, pg. 15, by Shaikh 'Abdul-'Aziz bin Baz.

pageTitle: Dua for a deceased child at the funeral prayer #2

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ لَنَا فَرَطاً، وَسَلَفاً، وَأَجْراً
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maj'alhu lanaa faratan, wa salafan, wa 'ajran.
details.translations: O Allah, make him for us a precursor, a forerunner and a cause of reward.
details.Reference: Al-Hasan (Al-Basri) used to recite Al-Fatihah for a child's funeral and then say this. Al-Bukhari, Kitabul-Jana'iz, p. 65.

pageTitle: Dua for a deceased child at the funeral prayer #3

details.arabic: إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا أَخَذَ، وَلَهُ مَا أَعْطَى، وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ عِنْدَهُ بِأَجَلٍ مُسَمَّى فَلْتَصْبِرْ وَلْتَحْتَسِبْ
details.transliteration: Inna lillaahi maa 'akha<u>th</u>a, wa lahu maa 'a'taa, wa kullu shay'in 'indahu bi'ajalin musamman… fal tasir waltahsib
details.translations: Surely, Allah takes what is His, and what He gives is His, and to all things He has appointed a time... so have patience and be rewarded.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 2/80, Muslim 2/636.

details.top: ...and one can also say:
details.arabic: أَعْظَمَ اللَّهُ أَجْرَكَ، وَأَحْسَنَ عَزَاءَكَ، وَغَفَرَ لِمَيِّتِكَ
details.transliteration: A'<u>dh</u>amallaahu 'ajraka, wa 'ahsana 'azaa'aka wa ghafara limayyitika.
details.translations: May Allah magnify your reward, and make perfect your bereavement, and forgive your departed.
details.Reference: An-Nawawi, Kitabul-'Athkar, p. 126.

details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَعَلَى سُنَّةِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahi wa 'alaa sunnati Rasoolillaahi.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah and according to the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 3/314 with an authentic chain. Ahmad also recorded it with the wording: With the Name of Allah, and according to the religion of the Messenger of Allah. Its chain is also authentic.

pageTitle: When placing the deceased in the grave

details.top: The Prophet (SAW) used to stop after burying the dead and say to the people: ''Ask Allah to forgive your brother and pray for him to be strengthened, for indeed he is now being questioned.''
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ، اللَّهُمَّ ثَبِّتْهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-maghfir lahu Allaahumma thabbithu.
details.translations: O Allah, forgive him. O Allah, strengthen him.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 3/315, and Al-Hakim 1/370 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed.

details.arabic: السَّلاَمُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الدِّيَارِ، مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُسْلِمِينَ، وَإِنَّا إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ بِكُمْ لاَحِقُونَ، (وَيَرْحَمُ اللَّهُ الْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنَّا وَالْمُسْتَأْخِرِينَ) أَسْاَلُ اللَّهَ لَنَا وَلَكُمُ الْعَافِيَةَ
details.transliteration: Assalaamu 'alaykum 'ahlad-diyaari, minal-mu'mineena walmuslimeena, wa 'innaa 'in shaa' Allaahu bikum laahiqoona [wa yarhamullaahul-mustaqdimeena minnaa walmusta'khireena] 'as'alullaaha lanaa wa lakumul- 'aafiyata.
details.translations: Peace be upon you, people of this abode, from among the believers and those who are Muslims, and we, by the Will of Allah, shall be joining you. [May Allah have mercy on the first of us and the last of us] I ask Allah to grant us and you strength.
details.Reference: Muslim 2/671, Ibn Majah 1/494, the portion brackets is from Muslim 2/671.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayrahaa, wa 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min sharrihaa.
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You for the good of it and seek refuge in You against its evil.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/326, Ibn Majah 2/1228. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mjjah 2/305

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَخَيْرَ مَا فِيهَا، وَخَيْرَ مَا أُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا، وَشَرِّ مَا فِيهَا، وَشَرِّ مَا أُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka kthayrahaa, wa khayra maa feehaa, wa khayra maa 'ursilat bihi wa a'oo<u>th</u>u bika min sharrihaa, wa sharri maa feehaa, wa sharri maa 'ursilat bihi.
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You for the good of it, for the good of what it contains, and for the good of what is sent with it. I seek refuge in You from the evil of it, from the evil of what it contains, and from the evil that is sent with it.
details.Reference: Muslim 2/616, Al-Bukhari 4/76.

details.arabic: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي يُسَبِّحُ الرَّعْدُ بِحَمْدِهِ وَالْمَلاَئِكَةُ مِنْ خِيفَتِهِ
details.transliteration: Subhaanal-la<u>th</u>ee yusabbihur-ra'du bihamdihi walmalaa'ikatu min kheefatihi.
details.translations: Glory is to Him Whom thunder and angels glorify due to fear of Him.
details.bottom: Whenever Abdullah bin Zubair (RA) would hear thunder, he would abandon all conversation and say this supplication.
details.Reference: See Al-Muwatta' 2/992. It was graded authentic by Al-Albani as a statement of Abdullah bin Zubayr only.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اسْقِنَا غَيْثاً مُغِيثاً مَرِيئاً مَرِيعاً، نَافِعاً غَيْرَ ضَارٍّ، عَاجِلاً غَيْرَ آجِلٍ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'asqinaa ghaythan mugheethan maree'an maree'an, naafi'an ghayradhaarrin, 'aajilan ghayra 'aajilin.
details.translations: O Allah, shower upon us abundant rain, beneficial not harmful, swiftly and not delayed.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1/303. See also Al-Albani SahihAbu Dawud 1/216.

details.top: Say three times:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَغِثْنَا
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'aghithnaa
details.translations: O Allaah, relieve us
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 2/613.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ اسْقِ عِبَادَكَ، وَبَهَائِمَكَ، وَانْشُرْ رَحْمَتَكَ، وَأَحْيِي بَلَدَكَ الْمَيِّتَ
details.transliteration: Allaahum-masqi 'ibaadaka, wa bahaa'imaka, wanshur rahmataka, wa 'ahyi baladakal-mayyita
details.translations: O Allah, give water to Your slaves, and Your livestock, and spread Your mercy, and revive Your dead land.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 1/305. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/218.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ صَيِّباً نَافِعاً
details.transliteration: Allaahumma sayyiban naafi'an
details.translations: O Allah, (bring) beneficial rain clouds.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 2/518

details.arabic: مُطِرْنَا بِفَضْلِ اللَّهِ وَرَحْمَتِهِ
details.transliteration: Mutirnaa bifadhlillaahi wa rahmatihi.
details.translations: It has rained by the bounty of Allah and His mercy
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/205, Muslim 1/83.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ حَوَالَيْنَا وَلاَ عَلَيْنَا، اللَّهُمَّ عَلَى الآكَامِ وَالظِّرَابِ، وَبُطُونِ الْأَوْدِيَةِ، وَمَنَابِتِ الشَّجَرِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma hawaalaynaa wa laa 'alaynaa. Allaahumma 'alal-'aakaami wa<u>dh</u>-<u>dh</u>iraabi, wa butoonil-'awdiyati, wa manaabitish-shajari.
details.translations: O Allah, let it pass us and not fall upon us, but upon the hills and mountains, and the center of the valleys, and upon the forested lands.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 1/224, Muslim 1/614

details.arabic: اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُمَّ أَهِلَّهُ عَلَيْنَا بِالْأَمْنِ وَالْإِيمَانِ، وَالسَّلاَمَةِ وَالْإِسْلاَمِ، وَالتَّوْفِيقِ لِمَا تُحِبُّ رَبَّنَا وَتَرْضَى، رَبُّنَا وَرَبُّكَ اللَّهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahu 'Akbar, Allaahumma 'ahillahu 'alayna bil'amni wal'eemaani, wassalaamati wal-'Islaami, wattawfeeqi limaa tuhibbu Rabbanaa wa tardhaa, Rabbunaa wa Rabbukallaahu.
details.translations: Allah is the Most Great. O Allah, bring us the new moon with security and Faith, with peace and in Islam, and in harmony with what our Lord loves and what pleases Him. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 5/504, Ad-Darimi 1/336. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/157.

details.arabic: ذَهَبَ الظَّمَأُ وَابْتَلَّتِ العُرُوقُ، وَثَبَتَ الْأَجْرُ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ
details.transliteration: Thahaba<u>dh</u>-<u>dh</u>ama'u wabtallatil-'urooqu, wa thabatal-'ajru 'inshaa'Allaah.
details.translations: The thirst is gone, the veins are moistened and the reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/306 and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/209.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِرَحْمَتِكَ الَّتِي وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَنْ تَغْفِرَ لِي
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka birahmatikal-latee wasi'at kulla shay'in 'an taghfira lee.
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy, which encompasses all things, that You forgive me.
details.Reference: Ibn Majah 1/557 from a supplication of Abdullah bin 'Amr. Al-Hafidh graded it as good in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-'Athkdr. See Sharhul- Athkar 4/342.

details.top: "When you are about to eat, you should say:
details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaah.
details.translations: In the Name of Allah.
