details.top: ...and if you forget to say it before starting, then you should say [when you remember] :
details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ فِي أَوَّلِهِ وَآخِرِهِ
details.transliteration: Bismillaahifee 'awwalihi wa 'aakhirihi.
details.translations: In the Name of Allah, in the beginning and in the end.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 3/347, At-Tirmithi 4/288. See Al- Albani's Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/167.

details.top: "Whomever Allaah feeds, should say:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيهِ وَأَطْعِمْنَا خَيْراً مِنْهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma baarik lanaafeehi wa 'at'imnaa khayranminhu.
details.translations: O Allah, bless us in it and provide us with better than it.

details.top: ...and whomever Allaah gives milk to drink, should say:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيهِ وَزِدْنَا مِنْهُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma baarik lanaa feehi wa zidnaa minhu.
details.translations: O Allah, bless us in it and give us more of it.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 5/506. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/158.

details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنِي هَذَا، وَرَزَقَنِيهِ، مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلاَ قُوَّةٍ
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-la<u>th</u>ee 'at'amanee haa<u>th</u>aa, wa razaqaneehi, min ghayri hawlin minnee wa laa quwwatin.
details.translations: Praise is to Allah Who has given me this food and sustained me with it though I was unable to doit and powerless.
details.bottom: Allah will forgive him for all previous sins
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi, Abu Dawud, and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/159.

details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ حَمْداً كَثِيراً طَيِّباً مُبَارَكاً فِيهِ، غَيْرَ (مَكْفِيٍّ وَلاَ) مُوَدَّعٍ، وَلاَ مُسْتَغْنَىً عَنْهُ رَبَّنَا
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahi hamdan katheeran tayyiban mubaarakan feehi, ghayra [makfiyyin wa laa] muwadda'in, wa laa mustaghnan 'anhu Rabbanaa.
details.translations: All praise is to Allah, praise in abundance, good and blessed. It cannot [be compensated for, nor can it] be left, nor can it be done without, our Lord.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 6/214, At-Tirmithi 5/507.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَهُمْ فِيمَا رَزَقْتَهُمْ، وَاغْفِرْ لَهُمْ وَارْحَمْهُمْ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma baarik lahum feemaa razaqtahum, waghfir lahum warhamhum.
details.translations: O Allah, bless them in what You have provided for them, and forgive them and have mercy on them.
details.Reference: Muslim 3/1615.

pageTitle: Dua by the guest for the host

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَطْعِمْ مَنْ أَطْعَمَنِي، وَاسْقِ مَنْ سَقَانِي
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'at'im man 'at'amanee wasqi man saqaanee.
details.translations: O Allah, feed the one who has fed me and drink to the one who has given me drink.
details.Reference: Muslim 3/126.

pageTitle: To one offering a drink or to one who intended to do that

details.arabic: أَفْطَرَ عِنْدَكُمُ الصَّائِمُونَ، وَأَكَلَ طَعَامَكُمُ الْأَبْرَارُ، وَصَلَّتْ عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ
details.transliteration: Aftara 'indakumus-saa'imoona, wa 'akala ta'aamakumul-'abraaru, wa sallat 'alaykumul-malaa'ikatu.
details.translations: With you, those who are fasting have broken their fast, you have fed those who are righteous, and the angels recite their prayers upon you.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 3/367, Ibn Majah 1/556, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah 296-8. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/730.

pageTitle: When breaking fast in someone's home

details.top:
"If you are invited [to a meal] then answer.

If you happen to be fasting, then supplicate [for those present] and if you are not fasting, then eat."
details.Reference: Muslim 2/1054

pageTitle: By one fasting when presented with food

details.arabic: إِنِّي صَائِمٌ، إِنِّي صَائِمٌ
details.transliteration: 'Inneesaa'imun, 'innee saa'imun.
details.translations: I am fasting. I am fasting.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/181, Muslim 4/2208.

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِي ثَمَرِنَا، وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مَدِينَتِنَا، وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي صَاعِنَا، وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مُدِّنَا
details.transliteration: Allahumma baarik lanaa fee thamarinaa, wa baarik lanaa fee madeenatinaa wa baarik lanaa fee saa'inaa, wa baarik lanaa fee muddinaa.
details.translations: O Allah, bless us in our dates and bless us in our town, bless us in our Sa' and in our Mudd.
details.bottom: Sa' and Mudd are both dry measures used for agricultural produce by the Arabs in the Prophet's time. (Of the two, the Sa' was the larger measure.) (Translator)
details.Reference: Muslim 2/1000

pageTitle: Upon seeing the early or premature fruit

details.top: "When one of you sneezes he should say:
details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaah
details.translations: All praises and thanks are to Allah.

details.top: ...and his brother or companion should say to him:
details.arabic: يَرْحَمُكَ اللَّهُ
details.transliteration: Yarhamukallaah
details.translations: May Allah have mercy upon you.

details.top: ...and he [i.e. the one who sneezed] replies back to him:
details.arabic: يَهْدِيكُمُ اللَّهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُم
details.transliteration: Yahdeekumul-laahu wa yuslihu baalakum.
details.translations: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/125.

details.arabic: يَهْدِيكُمُ اللَّهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُم
details.transliteration: Yahdeekumullaahu wa yuslihu baalakum.
details.translations: May Allah guide you and set your affairs in order.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhaaree with Al-Fath 10/88 and Muslim 3/1595

pageTitle: What is said to a kaafir when he sneezes

details.arabic: بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ، وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَمَعَ بَيْنَكُمَا فِي خَيْرٍ
details.transliteration: Baarakallaahu laka, wa baaraka 'alayka, wa jama'a baynakumaa fee khayrin.
details.translations: May Allah bless you, and shower His blessings upon you, and join you together in goodness.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/316.

details.top: When you marry a woman or buy a maidservant, you should say:
details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَخَيْرَ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا، وَشَرِّ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayrahaa wa khayra majabaltahaa 'alayhi wa 'a'oothu bika min sharrihaa wa sharri maajabaltahaa 'alayhi.
details.translations: O Allah, I ask You for the goodness of her and the goodness upon which You have created her, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of her and from the evil upon which You have created her.
details.bottom: If you purchase a camel then take hold of the top of its hump and say the same.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 2/248 and Ibn Majah 1/617. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/324

pageTitle: On the wedding night or when buying an animal

details.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، اللَّهُمَّ جَنِّبْنَا الشَّيْطَانَ، وَجَنِّبِ الشَّيْطَانَ مَا رَزَقْتَنَا
details.transliteration: Bismillaah. Allaahumma jannibnash-Shaytaana, wa jannibish-Shaytaana maa razaqtanaa.
details.translations: With the Name of Allah. O Allah, keep the I Devil away from us and keep the Devil away from that which You provide for us.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 6/141, Muslim 2/1028.

details.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
details.transliteration: 'A'oo<u>th</u>u billaahi minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem.
details.translations: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari 7/99, Muslim 4/2015.

details.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي عَافَانِي مِمَّا ابْتَلاَكَ بِهِ، وَفَضَّلَنِي عَلَى كَثِيرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضِيلاً
details.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-la<u>th</u>ee 'aafaanee mimmab-talaaka bihi wa fadhdhalanee 'alaa katheerin mimman khalaqa tafdheela.
details.translations: Praise is to Allah Who has spared me what He has afflicted you with, and preferred me greatly above much of what He has created.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi 5/493,4. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/153.

pageTitle: Upon seeing someone in trial or tribulation

details.top: Ibn 'Umar (radhi-yAllaahu 'anhumaa) said: It would be counted that at any one sitting, the Messenger of Allaah (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) before getting up would say one hundred times:
details.arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَتُبْ عَلَىَّ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الْغَفُورُ
details.transliteration: Rabbighfir lee wa tub 'alayya 'innaka 'Antat-Tawwaabul-Ghafoor.
details.translations: My Lord, forgive me and accept my repentance, You are the Ever-Relenting, the All-Forgiving.
details.Reference: Sahih Ibn Majah 2/321. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/153.

pageTitle: Dua said at a sitting or gathering etc.

details.top: Aishah (RA) said: 'Allah's Messenger (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) did not sit in a gathering, and did not recite the Qur'an, and did not perform any prayer without concluding by saying:
details.arabic: سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ، أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْكَ
details.transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma wa bihamdika, 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, 'astaghfiruka wa 'atoobu 'ilayka.
details.translations: Glory is to You, O Allah, and praise is to You. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but You. I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi and An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/ 153. This was reported by An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no.308), and Dr. Farooq Hamadah graded it authentic in his checking of the same book, p. 273. See also Ahmad 6/77

pageTitle: Dua at the end of a sitting/gathering [Kaffaratul Majlis]

details.top: Adbullaah Ibn Sarjis (radhi-yAllaahu 'anhu) said: " I went to see The Prophet (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) and ate from his food and then said to him:
details.arabic: غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَكَ يَا رَسُولَ للَّهِ
details.transliteration: GafarAllahu laka wa Rasoolallahi
details.translations: "May Allaah forgive you, O Messenger of Allaah.'

details.top: ...He replied:
details.arabic: وَلَكَ
details.transliteration: Walaka
details.translations: And you.
details.Reference: Ahmad 5/82, and An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 218, with checking by Dr. Farooq Hamadah.

details.top: "If someone does you a favour then you say:
details.arabic: جَزَاكَ اللَّهُ خَيْراً
details.transliteration: Jazaakallaahu khayran.
details.translations: May Allah reward you with good.
details.Reference: At-Tirmithi (no. 2035). See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/200 and Sahihul-Jami' (no. 6244).

pageTitle: To one who does you a favour

details.top:
Whoever memorizes ten 'Ayat (Verses) from the beginning of Surat Al-Kahf, will be protected from the False Messiah. [1] 

One can also say in every prayer after the final Tashahhud before ending the prayer, seeking the protection of Allah from the trials of the False Messiah:
details.translations: Please go to 24.1 and 24.2 [2]
details.Reference:
[1] Muslim 1/555, another version mentions the last ten 'Ayat, Muslim 1/556.
[2] See dua 24.1 and 24.2

details.arabic: أَحَبَّكَ الَّذِي أَحْبَبْتَنِي لَهُ
details.transliteration: 'Ahabbakal-lathee 'ahbabtanee lahu.
details.translations: May He for Whose sake you love me, love you.
details.Reference: Abu Dawud 4/333. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/965.

pageTitle: To one who pronounces his love for you, for Allah’s sake

details.arabic: بَارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ فِي أَهْلِكَ وَمَالِكَ
details.transliteration: Baarakallaahu laka fee 'ahlika wa maalika.
details.translations: May Allah bless you in your family and your property.
details.Reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-BAri 4/88.

pageTitle: To one who has offered you some of his wealth

details.arabic: بارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكَ فِي أَهْلِكَ وَمَالِكَ، إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ السَّلَفِ الْحَمْدُ وَالأَدَاءُ
details.transliteration: Baarakallaahu laka fee 'ahlika wa maalika, 'innamaa jazaa'us-salafil-hamdu wal'adaa'.
details.translations: May Allah bless you in your family and your wealth, surely the reward for a loan is praise and returning (what was borrowed).
details.Reference: An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylahp. 300, Ibn Majah 2/809. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah2/55.

pageTitle: To the debtor when his debt is settled

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أُشْرِكَ بِكَ وَأَنَا أَعْلَمُ، وَأَسْتَغْفِرُكَ لِمَا لاَ أَعْلَمُ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oo<u>th</u>u bika 'an 'ushrika bika wa 'anaa 'a'lamu, wa 'astaghfiruka limaa laa 'a'lamu.
details.translations: O Allah, I seek refuge in You lest I associate anything with You knowingly, and I seek Your forgiveness for what I know not.
details.Reference: Ahmad 4/403. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 3/233 and Sahihut-Targhib wat- Tarhib 1/19.

details.top:
'Aaishah (radhi-yAllaahu 'anhaa) reported that the Messenger of Allaah (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) was given a sheep and he ordered for it's distribution.

When the servant would come back [from distributing it] , 'Aaishah would ask:

"What did they say?", he replied: "They would supplicate:
details.arabic: بَارَكَ اللَّهُ فِيكُمْ
details.transliteration: barakAllahu feekum
details.translations: "May Allaah bless you all.'

details.top: ...'Aaishah would then say:
details.arabic: وَ فِيهِم بَارَكَ اللَّهُ
details.transliteration: wa feehim barakAllahu
details.translations: "and may Allaah bless them."

details.top: So we return their supplication in a similar way and our reward remains with us:
details.arabic: وَفِيكَ بَارَكَ اللَّهُ
details.transliteration: wa feeka barakAllahu
details.translations: "and May Allah bless you.'
details.Reference: Ibn As-Sunni (Page 138 , Hadith no. 278).Also see, Ibnul Qaiyyum's Al Wabilus Sayyer Page 308. Tahkeek, Bashir Mamud Uyyun.

pageTitle: Dua to one who says 'May Allaah bless you'

details.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ لاَ طَيْرَ إِلاَّ طَيْرُكَ، وَلاَ خَيْرَ إِلاَّ خَيْرُكَ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ غَيْرُكَ
details.transliteration: Allaahumma laa tayra 'illaa tayruka, wa laa khayra 'illaa khayruka, wa laa 'ilaaha ghayruka.
details.translations: O Allah there is no portent other than Your portent, no goodness other than Your goodness, and none worthy of worship other than You.
details.Reference: Ahmad 2/220, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 292). See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadlth As-Sahihah 3/54, (no. 1065). As for bodings of good, these used to please the Prophet (SAW) and so when he heard good words from someone, he used to say: ''We have taken from you a good portent from your mouth,'' Abu Dawud, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/363, and it is with Abu Ash-Shaikh Al-Asfahani in 'Akhlaqun-Nabiyy, pg. 270.

pageTitle: Forbiddance of ascribing things to omens
